name: Thick Noodles in Clear Broth
details: Noodles in a clear broth, topped with vegetables such as mushrooms and green onions.

name: Cylindrical Rice Pasta
details: Cylindrical rice pasta sliced diagonally into ovals. Cooked in a beef broth to make a traditional soup for New Year's Day.

name: Steamed Stingray
details: Marinated stingray steamed and served with thinly sliced mushrooms, vegetables, and julienned egg garnish.

name: Grilled Sole
details: Sole seasoned with salt then grilled, often topped with a spicy soy sauce.

name: Spicy Fermented Sole
details: A spicy dish of sole mixed with cooked millet and white radish, and seasoned with red chili pepper powder and garlic. Famous in the Hamgyeong-do region of North Korea.

name: Braised Sole
details: Sole seasoned with soy sauce, sugar, green onions, garlic and red chili pepper powder, then slowly simmered over low heat to reduce the liquid.

name: Eggplant Namul
details: Eggplant steamed then marinated in soy sauce, green onions, garlic, red chili pepper powder, sesame oil and vinegar.

name: Stuffed Eggplant
details: Eggplants cut lengthwise, filled with seasonings, and simmered in broth.

name: Pan-fried Eggplant
details: Eggplant slices coated with flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried.

name: Stuffed Eggplant with Beef
details: Eggplant cut lengthwise, filled with seasoned minced beef, and cooked in boiling water.

name: Sauteed Beef Liver
details: Beef or calf liver sauteed with vegetables such as green onions, garlic, ginger and carrots, then seasoned with soy sauce, sugar and pepper.

name: Crab Marinated in Soy Sauce
details: A marinated crab dish. The crab is marinated for three days in soy sauce, then the soy sauce is poured out, boiled, and poured back over the crab. It is left to sit for another three days before serving.

name: Pan-fried Beef Liver
details: Thinly sliced beef liver seasoned with salt and pepper, then coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried.

name: Chopped Raw Beef Liver
details: Fresh raw beef liver and tripe chopped thinly and seasoned with sesame oil, black pepper, salt and a pinch of ground pine nuts over the top.

name: Marinated and Grilled Beef Short Ribs
details: Beef short ribs marinated in a mixture of soy sauce, green onions, garlic, black pepper, sugar and sesame oil for a few hours, then grilled. Marinated short ribs are called yangnyeom-galbi and ribs which are not marinated are called saenggalbi. Galbi-gui is also known as bulgalbi. This is one of the most popular dishes in Korea.

name: Braised Short Ribs
details: Beef short ribs cut into chunks, seasoned with soy sauce, garlic, sugar and other spices, then simmered over a long period with pieces of Korean radish, carrots, chestnuts, jujubes, and ginkgo nuts. The dish is topped with julienned egg garnish and ground pine nuts.

name: Grilled Hairtail
details: Hairtail (a long, flat silver fish) cut into 10 centimeter lengths and grilled with salt.

name: Braised Hairtail
details: Hairtail (a long, fiat silver fish) cut into l0 centimeter lengths and braised with white radish or other vegetables in soy sauce until reduced.

name: Potato Cake
details: Small cakes made of potato starch mixed with a little salt and sugar.

name: Sauteed Potato
details: Julienned potatoes sauteed in oil and served as a side dish.

name: Half-moon Potato Cake
details: Cakes made of potato starch with a sweet filling, folded into a half-moon shape and steamed.

name: Pan-fried Potato
details: Thin slices of potato dipped in a flour batter and pan-fried.

name: Braised Potato
details: Cubed potatoes braised with fish or dried anchovies, soy sauce and oil. Served as a side dish.

name: Potato Soup
details: Soup made of potato and green onions in a beef broth.

name: Mustard Leaf Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of gat, a kind of mustard leaf. The stems and leaves are seasoned with pickled anchovy sauce. The strong flavor of the mustard leaf and the anchovy is what makes this kimchi popular.

name: Rice with Corn
details: Rice cooked with mixed grains, corn, and kidney beans; served as an alternative to white rice.

name: Corn and Grain Porridge
details: Porridge made of mashed corn with cooked red beans or other types of beans, thickened with glutinous rice flour.

name: Deep-fried Sweet Rice Puffs
details: Traditional treats made of sweet rice flour and liquor. They are cut into various shapes, dried in the shade, deep-fried in oil, and coated in honey and other sweet seasonings such as black bean, sesame seed, cinnamon, pine nut, and black sesame. They are usually hollow inside, and slightly sweet.

name: Basic Seasonings
details: The main basic seasonings used to flavor most Korean dishes : soy sauce, green onions, garlic, black pepper, red chili pepper powder, sesame oil, and sesame seeds.

name: Half-moon Puffed Rice Cake
details: Rice cake made with white rice flour, filled with red bean and folded into a half-moon shape. Also called baramtteok (wind rice cake) because it is puffed inside.

name: Dried Fish Slices
details: Whole fish cleaned, salted, and dried in the open air.

name: Fresh Kimchi
details: The leaves of Chinese cabbage or other leafy vegetables dressed in soy sauce and spices and served fresh as a side dish.

name: Crab
details: Koreans enjoy eating many types of crab including blue crab, tanner crab, freshwater crab, hairy crab and small crab. Crab is prepared in soups, casseroles or seasoned in soy sauce or red chili sauce.

name: Crab Patries
details: Patties made of cooked crab meat seasoned with soy sauce, coated with flour and egg, then pan-fried.

name: Marinated Crab
details: Crabs are marinated in soy sauce for several days, then the soy sauce is removed, boiled, and poured back over the crabs several times. This dish may also be seasoned with spices and red chili sauce.

name: Assorted Cold Plate with Mustard Sauce
details: Salad made with various cold cuts and fresh vegetables, dressed with a spicy mustard sauce.

name: Mustard and Vinegar Sauce
details: Tangy sauce of mustard, vinegar and sugar. This generally accompanies cold dishes such as raw fish or naengchae, a dish consisting of thinly sliced vegetables and meat or seafood.

name: Gyeolmyeongja Tea
details: A tea made with the dried seeds of the sicklepod plant, which can be served hot or cold. This tea is known for its clarifying effects on the liver and eyes.

name: Sweet Rice Balls
details: Rice cake made with glutinous rice flour, rolled into balls and cooked in boiling water. The cooked rice balls are then rolled in ground soybeans or red beans.

name: Egg Soup
details: Soup made by adding beaten eggs and chopped green onions to a boiling meat or vegetable broth.

name: Cinnamon Tea
details: Tea made of dried whole cinnamon sticks boiled with a small amount of ginger. This tea is usually garnished with minced jujubes (Korean dates).

name: Cooked Sweet Potato Stems
details: Side dish made with the stems of the sweet potato. The stems are blanched and seasoned, then lightly fried with oil.

name: Pan-fried Sweet Potato
details: Slices of sweet potato dipped in flour and egg, then pan-fried.

name: Deep-fried Sweet Potato
details: Sweet potato cut into thin oval slices or strips and deep-fried.

name: Godeulppaegi Kimchi
details: A strongly flavored kimchi made with a wild flowering plant (godeulppaegi) which has been soaked in water for up to ten days to remove its bitter taste.

name: Grilled Mackerel
details: Mackerel sprinkled with salt and grilled.

name: Braised Mackerel
details: Mackerel seasoned with soy sauce, green onions, garlic and red chili pepper powder, then braised over low heat until reduced.

name: Garnish
details: Popular Korean garnishes include thinly red chili pepper threads, julienned egg yolk and whites (the yolks and whites are separated, beaten, and pan-fried like crepes), minced jujubes (Korean dates), chestnuts, walnuts, ground pine nuts, cooked gingko nuts, sesame salt, minari (Korean parsley), carrots, green onions, and mushrooms.

name: Powder Coating for Rice Cake
details: Rice cakes are cooked then rolled or coated in a powder to add flavor and color and to prevent them from sticking together. The most popular are ground or whole red beans, beans of other colors, steamed and crushed chestnuts, or pan-fried bean flour.

name: Fiddlehead(s)
details: Young fern shoots are picked, blanched, drained, and then dried in the open air. The dried fiddleheads are used in soups or soaked in water and then pan??fried to make a side dish (fiddlehead namul).

name: Fiddlehead Namul
details: Side dish of fiddleheads that have been dried, soaked in water, then lightly pan-fried and seasoned.

name: Chili Pepper(s)
details: The Korean red pepper or chili is usually less spicy than its Latin American cousin. Korean food uses both young green peppers as well as the ripe red ones. The red peppers are dried and ground into chili powder which can be stored for long periods and is one of the most common seasonings in Korean cuisine. The leaves are also cooked to make a vegetable side dish. Young green peppers are eaten fresh as a side dish.

name: Sauteed Green Chili Peppers
details: Side dish made of young green chili peppers sliced lengthwise and stir-fried with other green vegetables such as bell pepper and celery.

name: Red Chili Pepper Paste
details: One of the main components of Korean cuisine. This spicy red paste is made of red chili pepper powder, fermented soybeans, white rice flour and salt. It can be used as a cooking ingredient or put on the table as a separate dipping or mixing sauce.

name: Pickled Green Chili Peppers
details: Young green chili peppers are pickled in salt and water for a week, then mixed with a salty, spicy sauce.

name: Pan-fried Stuffed Green Chili Peppers
details: Green chili peppers cut lengthwise and stuffed with ground beef. The stuffed peppers are then coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried.

name: Braised Green Chili Peppers
details: Side dish made of young green chili peppers braised in soy sauce with beef, clams, dried squid, or dried anchovies until reduced.

name: Steamed Green Chili Peppers
details: Green chili peppers coated in flour, steamed, and seasoned with soy sauce and spices.

name: Red Chili Pepper Powder
details: A powder made of ground Korean red chili pepper. This is a major ingredient used to spice many dishes in Korean cuisine.

name: Chili Pepper Leaf Namul
details: Side dish made of chili pepper leaves that are blanched and seasoned.

name: Spicy Freshwater Snails
details: Cooked freshwater snail tossed with chopped fresh vegetables and a spicy sauce.

name: Noodles in Thick Beef Soup
details: Noodles in a meat broth that has been simmered for a long time. Served in a large bowl.

name: Thick Beef Soup
details: Soup made from a stock of beef bones simmered for eight to twelve hours. The broth has a milky appearance and the meat is very tender. Gomtang is not seasoned during the cooking process and is served with salt and chopped green onions on the side so it can be seasoned to taste at the table. This soup is generally served with kkakdugi (a kimchi made of radishes).

name: Grilled Beef Tripe
details: Beef tripe seasoned with spices or salt and grilled.

name: Spicy Beef Tripe Hot Pot
details: A spicy, flavorful hot pot of vegetables and seasoned beef tripe cooked in a beef broth.

name: Dried Persimmon
details: Persimmons that are peeled and fully dried in the open air. This very sweet, flavorful dried fruit is eaten on its own as a dessert or a snack and is also used in rice cakes or dessert drinks like persimmon punch.

name: Traditional Candied Fruit
details: Candied fruit that has been cooked in boiling water and strained, then left to harden in attractive shapes.

name: Raw Halibut
details: Fresh halibut (preferably alive just before preparation) that is filleted, sliced thinly, and served raw.

name: Gugija Tea
details: Tea made from the dried fruit of the Chinese matrimony vine. Usually served as a medicinal tea.

name: Platter of Nine Delicacies
details: One of the most popular appetizers in Korean cuisine, this dish is served in a special platter that is divided into nine sections. The middle section holds small crepes made of flour and water, and in each of the eight surrounding sections is a different finely chopped ingredient, such as vegetables, beef, and abalone, resulting in a colorful and beautiful presentation. Once served, people place small amounts of each type of ingredient onto a crepe, roll it up, then dip it in a mix of soy sauce and vinegar before eating.

name: Soup
details: Soup, along with rice, is one of two essential elements of a Korean meal and is considered a main dish. Soups are made of vegetables, seafood, or meat and are seasoned with either salt, soy sauce or soybean paste (doenjang).

name: Soup with Rice
details: This main dish is a combination of the traditionally separate bowls of rice and soup with the steamed rice served in the bowl of soup.

name: Noodle(s)
details: Made from a multigrain flour, these thin noodles are cooked in boiling water, drained, and eaten in a broth or spicy sauce.

name: Noodles in Clear Broth
details: Soup made of noodles cooked in boiling water, drained, and served in a hot broth with various toppings.

name: Noodle Hot Pot
details: Hot pot of meat and vegetables in broth. The noodles are added when rest of the ingredients are nearly cooked.

name: Chrysanthemum Rice Wine
details: Rice wine flavored by adding dried chrysanthemum petals to the wine during maturation.

name: Oyster Rice
details: Rice cooked with fresh oysters. The rice is washed and cooked with the oysters in a clear seaweed or chicken broth.

name: Dried Yellow Croaker
details: Yellow croaker, salted and dried.

name: Pan-fried Oyster
details: Fresh oysters coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried. Also called seokhwajeon.

name: Spicy Pickled Oyster
details: Oysters pickled in salt with red chili pepper powder.

name: Oyster Soup
details: Soup made with fresh oysters, white radish, dubu (soybean curd / tofu) and green onions. The soup is seasoned with pickled shrimp sauce.

name: Deep-fried Oyster
details: Fresh oysters dipped in a flour batter and deep-fried.

name: Dried Laver
details: This seaweed has sheet-like fronds and grows along the western and southern coasts of Korea. It is dried in sheets, then lightly oiled, salted, and roasted. Gim is usually eaten wrapped around a spoonful of rice.

name: Toasted Laver
details: Dried laver sheets lightly coated with sesame oil, sprinkled with salt, then toasted on a hot pan or over a low flame.

name: Seasoned Laver
details: Dried laver toasted, broken into small pieces, then seasoned.

name: Rice Rolls in Laver
details: To make this colorful roll, rice is spread on a dried laver sheet with beef, fried egg, pickled radish, and various steamed vegetables, then rolled and cut into slices.

name: Deep-fried Laver
details: Dried laver coated in a batter of glutinous rice starch, dried, and deep-fried.

name: Kimchi
details: Kimchi is Korea's definitive dish. Basic kimchi is made by soaking Chinese cabbage and white radish in salt water, then mixing it with red chili pepper powder, green onions, garlic, ginger and fish sauce. The kimchi acquires its strong flavor during the fermentation process. There are hundreds of types of kimchi, depending on the main vegetable ingredient, the type of fish sauce or other spices, and preparation method.

name: Chilled Noodle Soup with Kimchi
details: Buckwheat noodles served in a chilled broth, topped with kimchi.

name: Pan-fried Kimchi Brochette
details: Brochettes of cabbage kimchi, beef strips, and green onions sliced into similar lengths, dipped in flour and egg, and pan-fried.

name: Kimchi Dumplings
details: Dumplings made with a filling that includes kimchi.

name: Rice or Noodles in Chilled Kimchi Water
details: Rice or noodles served in chilled kimchi water (the seasoned watery sauce from kimchi). This is a specialty of the Pyeongan-do region in North Korea.

name: Rice Cooked with Kimchi
details: Rice cooked with thin slices of kimchi and sometimes meat and soybean sprouts.

name: Sauteed Kimchi
details: Thinly sliced kimchi sauteed in oil. Chopped pork is often added and sauteed together with the kimchi.

name: Fried Rice with Kimchi
details: Rice fried with chopped kimchi. Chopped beef and other ingredients can also be added.

name: Kimchi Pancake
details: Fried pancakes made with finely chopped kimchi in a flour and egg batter.

name: Kimchi Stew
details: A thick stew made from kimchi simmered with various kinds of meat.

name: Kimchi Soup
details: A soup of chopped kimchi that is not as thick as kimchi stew and usually has fewer ingredients.

name: Diced Radish Kimchi
details: Kimchi made of diced white radish. The radish pieces are first salted and then mixed with the traditional kimchi sauce of red chili pepper powder, fish sauce, garlic, and green onions.

name: Sesame (Seeds) (1)
details: Sesame seeds include basic sesame seeds and perilla, or wild sesame seeds. ln both cases, the seeds are fried before the oil is extracted, which is used to provide flavor in Korean cuisine.

name: Sesame Toffee
details: A toffee made of roasted sesame seeds mixed in a malt toffee. The toffee hardens slightly as it cools and then it is cut into squares or rolled and sliced into flat round pieces.

name: Noodles in Sesame Soup
details: Noodles in a sesame soup with beef meatballs, minari (Korean parsley), stir??fried shiitake mushrooms, and julienned cucumbers

name: Sesame Salt
details: Sesame seeds roasted in a pan and ground with salt. One of the main seasonings in Korean cooking, this gives food a slightly buttery flavor.

name: Sesame Porridge
details: A porridge made of sesame seeds that are fried and ground, then mixed with rice flour and simmered until thick.

name: Sesame Soup
details: Soup of roasted and ground sesame seeds cooked in a chicken broth.

name: Wild Sesame Leaf Namul
details: A side dish made of wild sesame leaves that are blanched and seasoned.

name: Deep-fried Wild Sesame Leaves
details: Wild sesame leaves coated on one side with a batter of glutinous rice starch and deep-fried .The leaves are sometimes sprinkled with sugar.

name: Pickled Wild Sesame Leaves
details: A pickled side dish made of wild sesame leaves marinated in soy sauce. Other versions include sesame leaves pickled in soybean paste or fish sauce.

name: Pan-fried Wild Sesame Leaves with Fillings
details: Wild sesame leaves folded in half with a filling of seasoned minced beef. The stuffed leaves are coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried.

name: Oxtail Soup
details: A soup made by simmering oxtail in water for three to four hours.

name: Seasoned Ark Shells
details: Cooked ark shells seasoned with soy sauce and served on the half-shell.

name: Meat and Vegetable Brochette
details: Brochettes of meat and vegetables, seasoned and grilled.

name: Pickled Small Octopus
details: A variety of small octopus that has been cleaned and pickled in salt.

name: Grilled Mackerel Pike
details: Mackerel pike (similar to mackerel but smaller and thinner) salted or spread with soybean paste (doenjang) and grilled.

name: Braised Mackerel Pike
details: Mackerel pike seasoned with green onions, garlic and a mixture of other ingredients (such as red chili pepper paste or soy sauce) and simmered over low heat.

name: Steamed Blue Crab Meat
details: Crab meat mixed with seasonings in a fluffy egg batter, then placed back in the shell, steamed, and garnished.

name: Blue Crab Soup
details: A soup of blue crab cooked with zucchini, green chili peppers and soybean paste (doenjang).

name: Meat Garnish
details: Minced cooked meat used to garnish soups and stews.

name: Grilled Pheasant
details: Thinly sliced pheasant thigh meat seasoned with soy sauce, sesame seeds, black pepper, green onions, ginger and garlic, and then grilled.

name: Pheasant Kimchi
details: A special kimchi of cooked pheasant meat mixed with whole white radish marinated in salt water. Some versions use pickled cucumbers instead of white radish.

name: Pheasant Dumplings
details: A dumpling stuffed with pheasant and vegetables, cooked in a clear broth, and served as a winter delicacy.

name: Home-style Noodles in Pheasant Soup
details: Home-style noodles made of flour, bean powder and egg, cooked in a pheasant broth.

name: Vegetable Side Dishes
details: Side dishes of vegetables or wild leafy greens. There are two main methods of preparation :stir-frying the vegetables with spices, and blanching the vegetables and then seasoning them. The most common seasonings are soy sauce, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, and chopped green onions.

name: Radish Water Kimchi
details: A slightly pink kimchi made with Chinese cabbage, thinly sliced white radish, a large amount of water, and minari (a leafy vegetable resembling parsley) to give this kimchi a distinctive a flavor.

name: Stir-fried Baby Octopus
details: Baby octopus mixed in a seasoning of red chili pepper paste and soy sauce, then stir-fried with onions, chili peppers and green onions.

name: Baby Octopus Hot Pot
details: Seasoned baby octopus cooked in a hot pot with green onions, crown daisy, and other vegetables.

name: Raw Baby Octopus
details: Live or poached baby octopus served with a dipping sauce of red chili pepper paste with vinegar and sugar.

name: Beef Tripe and Intestine Soup
details: Soup of beef, tripe and intestines cooked over a long period.

name: Chilled  Soup
details: Chilled soups made with eggplant, cucumber, or seaweed. Served in the summer with rice.

name: Chilled Noodle Soup
details: A soup of noodles in chilled yeolmu-kimchi (a water kimchi made of radishes and their leaves) and topped with julienned egg garnish and slices of beef.

name: Chilled Buckwheat Noodle Soup
details: Buckwheat noodles served in a chilled beef broth with slices of beef, radish kimchi, sliced Korean pear, a boiled egg, and seasoned cucumber on top. Vinegar and mustard are added to according to individual taste. This is a favorite summer dish.

name: Naengi
details: Shepherd's purse, a white-flowered plant in the cabbage family, which grows in fields and is picked and eaten in spring.

name: Naengi Namul
details: A vegetable side dish made of naengi (shepherd's purse) parboiled and mixed with a seasoned soy sauce.

name: Naengi Soup
details: A soup of naengi (shepherd's purse) in a soybean paste (doenjang) broth, usually with clams.

name: Grilled Sliced Beef
details: Thinly sliced beef marinated in a bulgogi sauce (soy sauce, sugar, garlic, green onions, and sesame oil), and then grilled.

name: Seasoned Overripe Cucumbers
details: Overripe cucumbers that have turned yellowish are peeled and soaked in salt water. The salted cucumbers are squeezed to eliminate excess water, then chopped and spiced with red chili pepper paste, vinegar, green onions, garlic, black pepper, and sugar.

name: Mung Bean
details: Mung beans are ground to make mung bean jelly, mung bean and vegetable pancakes, rice cake coating, and mung bean porridge, similar to a Chinese congee. Mung bean sprouts are also eaten as a vegetable side dish.

name: Mung Bean Jelly
details: A firm jelly made with mung bean starch. Also called cheongpomuk.

name: Mung Bean Pancake
details: A fried pancake made of mung bean flour and a little glutinous rice flour cooked with pork, sliced kimchi, green bean sprouts, green onions and garlic.

name: Mung Bean Porridge
details: A porridge of mung beans and rice, similar to Chinese congee.

name: Green Tea
details: A tea made from tea leaves picked when tender and green, then dried carefully to preserve the green color.

name: Green Tea Rice
details: Rice cooked in green tea instead of plain water.

name: Sea Bass
details: Sea bass is finely sliced and eaten raw, grilled, braised, or cooked in soups.

name: Browned Rice
details: Crusty, browned rice made from the scorched part of steamed rice that is usually stuck to the bottom of the rice pot. lt is eaten in hot water as a browned rice tea after a meal or fried as a crispy snack. Also called nurunbap.

name: Pan-fried Green Onion and Fiddlehead
details: Thin green onions and fiddleheads cut into similar lengths, then mixed in a flour and egg batter and pan-fried.

name: Small Freshwater Snail Soup
details: A soup made of soybean paste (doenjang) broth, red chili pepper paste, vegetables, and small freshwater snails. Also called olgaengitguk.

name: Kelp
details: Boiled and served cold with red chili pepper paste to make a vegetable for ssam, cooked to make a soup broth, or deep-fried as a side dish or snack.

name: Kelp Wraps
details: Slices of fresh kelp used as a wrap for rice and other foods, dipped in pickled anchovy sauce before eating.

name: Pan-fried King Prawn
details: Peeled king prawns coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried.

name: Steamed Stuffed King Prawns
details: King prawns stuffed with seasoned minced beef, steamed, and topped with mushrooms, julienned egg garnish, and red chili pepper threads.

name: Grilled Clams
details: Big clams grilled in the shell. The clams can also be chopped and mixed with minced beef, dubu (soybean curd / tofu) and seasonings, put back in the shell and then grilled.

name: Clam Soup(1)
details: A clear soup with clams. Sometimes the clams are taken from their shells, mixed with beef and seasonings, and put back in their shells before being cooked and put in the soup.

name: Clam Hot Pot
details: A hot pot of clams, beef, and vegetables in broth.

name: Clam and Rice Porridge
details: A porridge made of rice and clams.

name: Steamed Stuffed Clams
details: Clam shells stuffed with chopped clams, minced beef, shiitake mushrooms, and egg, and then steamed.

name: Deodeok
details: A perennial vine, the deodeok(bonnet bellflower) root has a distinctive smell. It is grilled or steamed as a side dish and is also used as medicine.

name: Grilled Deodeok
details: Deodoek root marinated in soy sauce and red chili pepper paste and then grilled.

name: Deodeok Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of deodeok root, white radish and Chinese cabbage.

name: Spicy Deodeok
details: Deodeok root shredded into small pieces by hand and seasoned with a red chili pepper paste sauce.

name: Deodeok Salad
details: Deodeok root mixed with red chili pepper powder and other seasonings.

name: Deodeok Pickles
details: A side dish of deodeok roots pickled in red chili pepper paste.

name: Ox Knee Soup
details: A soup made of beef and ox knee simmered for a long time. It is served with salt and chopped green onions on the side so it can be seasoned to taste at the table.

name: Bellflower Roots
details: The roots of the Bellflower are either grilled or seasoned and served raw.

name: Bellflower Root Namul
details: A side dish of bellflower roots cooked in water, drained, then sauteed with chopped green onions, garlic, and sesame salt.

name: Bellflower Root Salad
details: Fresh bellflower roots shredded into small pieces, then seasoned with red chili pepper powder, vinegar, salt, and sugar.

name: Candied Bellflower Roots
details: Whole bellflower roots (doraji) peeled and simmered in a mixture of water, honey, and sugar until candied.

name: Grilled Sea Bream
details: Sea bream seasoned with salt then grilled slowly over a low flame and basted frequently with sesame oil.

name: Braised Sea Bream
details: Sea bream seasoned in a spicy soy sauce and braised.

name: Sea Bream and Rice Porridge
details: A rice porridge with sea bream. The fish is cooled first and then deboned. The rice and fish meat is put into the fish broth and simmered until thick.

name: Stuffed and Steamed Sea Bream
details: Whole sea bream stuffed with clams, dubu (soybean curd / tofu), and vegetables and then steamed. The steamed fish is garnished with colorful vegetables and sliced chestnuts.

name: Raw Sea Bream
details: Fresh sea bream thinly sliced and served raw.

name: Chilled Acorn Noodle Soup
details: Noodles made of acorn starch served in a chilled broth and garnished with seasoned vegetables.

name: Acorn Cake
details: A steamed cake made of acorn starch, millet flour, and a coating of ground beans and red beans.

name: Acorn Starch jelly
details: A firm jelly made of acorn starch, often served with a seasoned soy sauce.

name: Dollamul
details: Sedum, a fleshy-leafed perennial that is found in the mountains. The tender young plants are often added to kimchi made in the spring or are made into a spring salad as a side dish.

name: Stone Pot Rice
details: Rice cooked in a stone pot with chestnuts, mushrooms, and jujubes (Korean dates).

name: Stone Pot Bibimbap
details: Rice cooked in a hot stone pot and topped with vegetables, seasoned and cooked ground beef, a fried egg and other ingredients. Before eating, red pepper paste or soy sauce and sesame oil are added to taste and everything is stirred with the rice.

name: Thick Rice Beer
details: A beer made by fermenting rice with yeast. In Korean, the term dongdongju suggests something floating, referring to the rice grains that are often floating on top.

name: Radish Kimchi in Water
details: A kimchi made of whole white radishes, green onions, garlic, ginger and salt water. The radishes are rolled in salt and put in a big jar with the other ingredients and salt water. After being cured, this kimchi has plenty of flavorful water which is chilled and served throughout the winter.

name: Buckwheat Noodles in Radish Kimchi Water
details: Buckwheat noodles served in chilled dongchimi water (a non-spicy kimchi made with white radish and lots of water) topped with sliced kimchi, a boiled egg and some meat.

name: Frozen Pollack
details: Frozen pollack does not have a strong smell and is therefore used in a lot of dishes.

name: Spicy Frozen Pollack Stew
details: A spicy stew of pollack with white radish, dubu (soybean curd / tofu), chili peppers, and other spices.

name: Kimchi with Frozen Pollack
details: A special mixed kimchi made of Chinese cabbage, white radish, and dried pollack pieces. Often made with dried pollack soaked in water.

name: Frozen Pollack Stew
details: A spicy stew made of pollack and vegetables. The pollack is first cooked in a clear broth, then white radish, red chili pepper powder or red chili pepper paste, garlic and green onions are added and cooked until thick.

name: Glazed Spareribs
details: Pork ribs first coated in a flour batter and deep-fried, then glazed in a sweet and spicy soy sauce mixture.

name: Grilled Spareribs
details: Pork spareribs marinated in a soy sauce or red chili pepper paste mixture and grilled.

name: Braised Spareribs
details: Pork spareribs seasoned and braised in a little broth with chili peppers, chestnuts, carrots and jujubes (Korean dates).

name: Pork
details: The main pork cuts used in Korean cuisine are the shoulder, sirloin, sides, ribs, hocks, and the rump. The different parts are prepared in different ways to take advantage of their distinct flavors and textures. Pig's head is boiled and pressed or made into a soup. Shoulder, sirloin, and rump cuts are grilled or braised. Rib cuts are braised or pressed. Hocks are pressed or used in soup.

name: Marinated Grilled Pork
details: Thin slices of pork marinated in soy sauce and red chili pepper paste and grilled. Also called dwaeji-bulgogi.

name: Pork and Kimchi Stir-fry
details: Chopped pork stir-fried with thinly sliced kimchi.

name: Stir-fried Pork
details: A spicy stir-fry of pork with chopped vegetables. Also called jeyuk-bokkeum.

name: Pressed Pork
details: Big pieces of pork cooked in water with ginger, green onions and soybean paste (doenjang) and pressed to give a smooth texture. Often served with pickled shrimp sauce.

name: Pressed Pork Head
details: Pork head meat cooked in water with ginger, onions, garlic and black pepper, then pressed into a block and sliced. Usually served on special occasions.

name: Pureed Soybean Stew
details: A thick white stew of soybean puree, pork, kimchi or fresh cabbage leaves. Served with seasoned soy sauce on the side.

name: Soybean Paste
details: A fermented soybean paste that is the base for many common Korean dishes.

name: Soybean Paste Soup
details: A soup made of soybean paste (doenjang) and vegetables.

name: Soybean Paste Stew
details: A stew made of soybean paste (doenjang) and various vegetables. Similar to soybean paste soup (doenjangguk) but much thicker.

name: Spicy Sliced Beef Stew
details: A stew made of beef, liver and tripe thinly sliced, seasoned, and cooked in broth with vegetables. A specialty of the southwestern regions of Korea.

name: Dureup
details: Shoots or young leaves of the fatsia (Japanese angelica) tree.

name: Dureup Namul
details: Blanched dureup shoots mixed with green onions, crushed garlic, soysauce, red chili pepper paste, vinegar and sesame oil.

name: Dureup and Beef Brochette
details: Blanched dureup shoots and beef slices mixed in a seasoned soy sauce and put on skewers. The brochettes are coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried.

name: Pan-fried Dureup
details: Blanched dureup shoots coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried.

name: Parboiled Dureup
details: Dureup shoots coated in potato starch and parboiled. Before serving, the cooked shoots are dipped in vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Pan-fried Dubu
details: Dubu (soybean curd / tofu) sliced into flat pieces and pan-fried.

name: Fancy Steamed Dubu
details: Mashed dubu (soybean curd / tofu) mixed with seasoned meat and topped with shiitake and other mushrooms, julienned egg garnish, red chili threads and sliced green onions. This thickened dubu is steamed.

name: Stuffed Dubu Hot Pot
details: Two slices of pan-fried dubu (soybean curd / tofu) stuffed with seasoned minced beef and tied with minari (Korean parsley) stems or green onions and cooked in a hot pot with vegetables, meatballs, marinated beef, and broth.

name: Dubu Stew with Pickled Shrimp
details: A stew made of simmered dubu (soybean curd / tofu) and fresh oysters seasoned with pickled shrimp sauce. Also called dubu-saeujeot-jjigae (dubu and pickled shrimp stew).

name: Braised Pan-fried Dubu
details: A dish of pan-fried slices of dubu (soybean curd / tofu) covered with soy sauce and braised until the sauce is absorbed by the dubu.

name: Dubu Stew
details: A stew with dubu (soybean curd / tofu) as the main ingredient.

name: Sweet Rice Cake with Fillings
details: Sticky rice cake filled with citron and pine nuts and then flattened into layers. Each layer is generously topped with a red bean mixture and steamed.

name: Wild Sesame Oil
details: Oil extracted from wild sesame seeds.

name: Wild Sesame Toffee
details: Malt candy made with roasted wild sesame seeds.

name: Wild Sesame and Rice Porridge
details: A rice porridge with ground wild sesame seeds.

name: Grilled Sirloin
details: A medium-thick sirloin steak that is usually grilled at the table.

name: Beef Soup and Rice
details: A popular dish in Korean restaurants consisting of beef and clotted blood soup served with rice. Ttaro-gukbap literally means soup and rice separately and originates in a rice soup once sold by street vendors. Following customer demand, however, the rice started to be served separately.

name: Rice Cake
details: Rice cakes made with flour from white rice, glutinous rice, beans, and peas. They are either steamed then boiled, or steamed, then kneaded or pan-fried. Tteok is served at important feasts and celebrations and is also enjoyed as a dessert or snack.

name: Grilled Short Rib Meat Patties
details: Square patties made of ground beef rib meat mixed with a seasoning of soy sauce, sugar, green onions, garlic, sesame seeds, and sesame oil, and then grilled.

name: Sliced Rice Pasta Soup
details: A soup of sliced ovals of rice pasta in a clear beef broth topped with slices of beef and julienned egg garnish. Served as a New Year's dish.

name: Brochette of Rice Pasta with Vegetables
details: A grilled brochette of rice pasta and vegetables.

name: Sliced Rice Pasta Soup with Dumplings
details: A soup of sliced ovals of rice pasta in a clear beef broth with dumplings.

name: Stir-fried Rice Pasta with Vegetables
details: A stir-fry dish made with rice pasta, seasoned beef and assorted vegetables. Recently, a spicy version with red chili pepper paste has become very popular.

name: Beef and Rice Cake Brochette
details: Brochette of beef and rice cake seasoned and then grilled.

name: Butterbur Stem Namul
details: Blanched stems of the butterbur (sweet colt's foot) sauteed and seasoned.

name: Grilled Eel
details: Fresh sea eel grilled over an open fire and seasoned with red chili pepper paste or simply salted to taste.

name: Raw Eel
details: Skinned fresh sea eel thinly sliced and served raw with vinegared red chili pepper paste, sliced green chili peppers, and sliced garlic on the side.

name: Sea Squirt
details: Sea squirt has red leathery skin but the inside flesh is yellow and soft. The yellow flesh is a delicacy and is served raw with a spicy dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Spicy Catfish Stew
details: A thick, spicy stew of freshwater catfish and vegetables.

name: Buckwheat
details: Buckwheat seeds are ground into a fine flour which is used to make noodles or a firm buckwheat jelly.

name: Buckwheat Noodles
details: Cooked buckwheat noodles chilled and served with a dipping sauce made of dried fish and seaweed.

name: Buckwheat Jelly
details: A firm jelly made of buckwheat that is sliced, topped with a seasoning sauce and shredded dried laver, and mixed with chopped kimchi.

name: Fermented Soybean Bricks
details: Fermented soybeans that are dried into bricks. This is the main ingredient for soy sauce and soybean paste (doenjang).

name: Dried Anchovies
details: Anchovies are sun-dried and prepared differently according to their size. The large anchovies are used to make broth; the mid-sized ones are braised in soy sauce, and the smallest ones are pan-fried. Fresh anchovies are also pickled in salt.

name: Sauteed Dried Anchovies
details: A side dish of dried anchovies pan-fried with soy sauce or red chili pepper paste and glazed with sugar or maltose syrup.

name: Pickled Pollack Roe
details: Pollack roe pickled in salt and red chili pepper powder and served as a side dish with rice.

name: Steamed Spicy Pollack Roe
details: Pollack roe steamed with red chili pepper powder, green onions, garlic, sesame oil, and ground sesame seeds.

name: Pollack
details: Pollack caught and frozen in the winter is called dongtae; completely dried pollack is called bugeo; pollack which is frozen and then dried is called hwangtae; and half-dried pollack is called kodari.

name: Chinese Quince
details: This fruit has a beautiful fragrance but is very hard and cannot be eaten fresh. Chinese quince are usually diced and mixed in honey or sugar. This mixture can be added to hot water to make a sweet fruit tea and is also used in fruit punch drinks.

name: Chinese Quince Tea
details: A sweet tea made of thin slices of Chinese quince that have been preserved in honey.

name: Assorted Pan-fried Delicacies
details: A dish of assorted pan-fried delicacies such as beef, fish fillet, mushrooms and summer squash slices that have been coated in flour and egg, and pan-fried.

name: Assorted Raw Fish
details: Various kinds of fresh fish sliced and served raw with soy sauce or vinegared red chili pepper paste for dipping. Generally, halibut, croaker, tuna, octopus, and sea bream are served in this dish.

name: White Radish
details: An important ingredient in kimchi, white radish is also braised and used in soups.

name: White Radish Namul
details: Julienned white radish mixed with green onions, garlic, ginger juice and salt and left to sit.

name: Seasoned Dried Radish
details: A side dish of julienned white radish that has been dried in the open air (a process that preserves vegetables over the winter) then briefly soaked in water and seasoned.

name: Dried Radish Pickles
details: Dried white radish slices pickled in soy sauce and mixed with other seasonings. Dried chili pepper leaves that have been soaked in water are often added as well.

name: Julienned Radish Salad
details: A salad of julienned white radish dressed with a mixture of red chili pepper powder, vinegar, salt, and sugar. Also called muchae-muchim.

name: Rainbow Rice Cake
details: Rice cake with different colored layers made of rice flour, salt, sugar, and coloring.

name: Radish Stem Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of the green part of radish stems and leaves.

name: Jelly
details: A firm jelly made of acorn, mung bean, or buckwheat starch boiled in water and cooled until it sets.

name: Munbaeju
details: A traditional liquor made of malted wheat, rice, and millet which originates in the Pyeongyang region of North Korea. lt is famous for its fragrance which is said to resemble the munbae rose, hence its name. The alcohol content is around 40%.

name: Parboiled Octopus
details: Octopus is parboiled, then sliced and served with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Water Kimchi
details: A variation of kimchi in water. Both the water and the crunchy pickled vegetable in it are eaten. This kind of kimchi includes sliced radish and cabbage kimchi (nabak-kimchi), kimchi made with whole baby white radishes and their stalks (yeolmu-kimchi), deodeok root kimchi (deodeok-mul-kimchi ), and ginseng, radish and cabbage kimchi (ginseng-nabak-kimchi).

name: Buckwheat Noodles in Chilled Broth
details: A soup with buckwheat noodles and various toppings served in a chilled broth. The version with a spicy sauce instead of the soup is called bibim??naengmyeon.

name: Boiled Dumplings
details: Dumplings cooked in water or broth and served with soup.

name: Maltose Syrup
details: A syrup made of malt and rice or other cereals. This thick, sweet syrup is used in many dishes.

name: Radish and Beef Soup
details: A soup made of white radish and seasoned beef.

name: Minari
details: A leafy green resembling parsley and a member of the dropwort family.

name: Minari Bundles with Meat
details: Blanched minari (Korean parsley) wrapped around cooked meat, julienned egg garnish, and red chili pepper and served with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Blanched and Seasoned Minari
details: Blanched minari (Korean parsley) mixed with a spicy sauce.

name: Cooked Mideodeok
details: Mideodeok (a small oval sea animal with wrinkly skin and soft orange flesh similar ta a sea squirt) mixed with bean sprouts and minari (Korean parsley) and braised in a small amount of broth with rice flour and red chili pepper powder.

name: Seasoned Young Ginseng
details: Thin, young ginseng roots seasoned with a spicy soy sauce or vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Grain Powder Drink Mix
details: A powder made from steamed rice that has been dried, toasted, and ground. lt is mixed with cold water and sugar or honey to make a popular summer drink.

name: Seaweed Soup
details: A soup made of seaweed that is soaked, drained, then cooked in a broth of beef or dried anchovies. This soup is traditionally given to mothers after childbirth.

name: Chilled Seaweed Soup
details: A seaweed soup served chilled. The seaweed is cooked first then mixed with soy sauce. Julienned cucumbers are added to the chilled soup.

name: Spicy Seaweed
details: Blanched fresh seaweed seasoned with soy sauce and vinegar or vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Seaweed Wraps
details: Blanched fresh seaweed cut into strips which are used to wrap spoonfuls of rice and other foods.

name: Seaweed and Cucumber Salad
details: Blanched fresh seaweed and sliced cucumbers mixed with a sweet vinegar dressing.

name: Rice Gruel
details: A thin, clear gruel made of one part rice and ten parts water. This is mostly given to patients because it is easy to drink.

name: Grilled Croaker
details: Salted and grilled croaker.

name: Spicy Croaker Stew
details: A spicy red stew with croaker, beef, summer squash, minari (Korean parsley), other vegetables, and garlic.

name: Dried Croaker Fillets
details: Fully dried croaker fillets seasoned with soy sauce, salt and sugar, then thinly sliced before eating.

name: Mini Crepes
details: A dish consisting of small crepes and thinly sliced vegetables and meat. The crepes are made of a flour and egg batter that is pan-fried over low heat. The crepes are then rolled with the sliced vegetables and meat inside.

name: Assorted Side Dishes
details: Side dishes such as cucumber pickles, beans or beef braised in soy sauce are made in large batches and served over a period of time. Most Korean households have an assortment of these dishes at any given time to provide a tasty accompaniment to rice.

name: Gourd Peel Namul
details: A side dish made of dried gourd skins that are soaked, seasoned, and cooked over low heat until the flavor is fully absorbed.

name: Side Dishes
details: A range of dishes eaten with rice to add flavor. The basic Korean meal consists of a bowl of rice, a soup or stew and some side dishes. Also called chan.

name: Chestnut(s)
details: The chestnut is used in diverse ways in Korean cuisine. Chestnuts are peeled and eaten raw as a companion for alcoholic drinks and put into cold dishes and even kimchi. They are also added to rice and braised beef rib dishes, are an important ingredient in many types of rice cake, and are served roasted, steamed, marinated in honey or made into cookies as a snack or dessert.

name: Sweet Rice Balls Coated with Chestnuts
details: Small rice cake balls made of glutinous rice. The balls are dipped in honey and rolled in ground chestnut.

name: Candied Chestnuts
details: Peeled chestnuts simmered in water with sugar or honey until candied.

name: Cooked Rice
details: Rice that has been washed, brought to a boil and simmered until cooked. ln Korean, the expression 'eating rice' means to have a meal. Rice is unquestionably the essence of a Korean meal. There are several varieties of cooked rice: white (non-glutinous) rice, sweet (glutinous) rice, and rice mixed with other grains.

name: Korean Pear
details: One of the most popular fruits in Korea, the Korean pear is bigger and rounder than its Western counterpart. lt is also has a very crunchy texture and more juice . Sliced pear is added to many Korean dishes.

name: Boiled Sweet Pear with Ginger
details: Peeled and sliced Korean pears cooked in water with black peppercorns, ginger and sugar, then garnished with ground pine nuts.

name: Chinese Cabbage
details: As the main ingredient in kimchi, white cabbage is halved and its layers of leaves are filled with a spicy mixture. Similar cabbages can be found in Japan and China.

name: Spicy Chinese Cabbage Salad Kimchi
details: A salad made of Chinese cabbage leaves that are separated and salted, then tossed in a dressing of red chili pepper powder, green onions, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil and some sugar.

name: Chinese Cabbage Kimchi
details: The most basic type of kimchi, made of whole Chinese cabbages. The cabbages are cut in half and then salted or soaked in salt water. Alter the leaves have lost some of their water, a mixture of julienned white radish, garlic, red chili pepper powder, green onions, fish sauce and ginger is spread over the layers of leaves. The cabbages are put in jars and left to season until the flavor is fully absorbed.

name: Chinese Cabbage Root Soup
details: A soup made of Chinese cabbage roots in a soybean paste (doenjang) broth with either beef or dried anchovies.

name: Chinese Cabbage Heart Soup
details: A soup made of the Chinese cabbage hearts in soybean paste (doenjang) broth with sliced beef and red chili pepper paste.

name: Chinese Cabbage Soup (1)
details: A soup made of soybean paste (doenjang) and Chinese cabbage leaves.

name: White Chinese Cabbage Kimchi
details: A version of cabbage kimchi with very small amounts of red chili pepper powder used only for seasoning the julienned radishes in the sauce.

name: Set Menu with Rice and Side Dishes (Restaurant Menu)
details: Baekban can mean simply steamed white rice or a full menu of rice, soup and side dishes. The names of baekban dishes vary according to the main dish or soup that accompanies the rice, for example, doenjang stew baekban or bulgogi baekban.

name: Steamed White Rice Cake
details: A white rice cake is cooked in a large steamer. This cake has a relatively coarse texture and is chewy and sweet. lt is traditionally shared with friends and neighbors at the feast celebrating the hundredth day after a baby's birth.

name: Pickled Large-eyed Herring
details: Sauce made of large-eyed herring that have been heavily salted and pickled to make a thick, dark fish sauce that will keep for a long time. Can be served as a side dish.

name: Dried Whitebait
details: Dried young whitebait are pressed into sheets, seasoned with red chili pepper paste, and grilled.

name: Mushroom
details: The most commonly used mushrooms in Korean cuisine are the fragrant pine (songi) mushrooms, oyster (neutari) mushrooms, wood ear (mogi) mushrooms (very dark and thin, used mostly in Chinese and Korean cuisine), enoki (paengi) mushrooms, coral (ssan) mushrooms, shiitake (pyogo) and common button mushrooms.

name: Mushroom Soup
details: A clear soup made of mushrooms, beef and dubu (soybean curd

name: Stir-fried Mushroom
details: A stir-fry of mushrooms, onions and beef with seasoned soy sauce.

name: Mixed Mushroom Hot Pot
details: A hot pot of mushrooms including shiitake, coral, and oyster mushrooms, sliced and laid together with seasoned meat and minari (Korean parsley).

name: Rice Wine (Gyeongju Style)
details: First created by a Gyeongju family, this high quality rice wine is made from bath white and glutinous rice. The alcohol content is approximately 15%.

name: Barley Rice
details: Rice cooked with barley.

name: Barley Balls in Omija Punch
details: A drink made of honey water and omija (fruit of the Chinese magnolia vine) with cooked barley balls coated in starch.

name: Barley Tea
details: Roasted barley cooked in water. Served bath hot and cold, this is one of the most common beverages found in Korean homes and restaurants and is often served instead of water.

name: Dog Soup
details: Dog meat slowly simmered then seasoned is a soybean paste (doenjang) soup with garlic, ginger, green onions, and red chili pepper powder. This soup is said to be an aphrodisiac.

name: Chinese Cabbage Wraps with Pork
details: Park and kimchi wrapped in steamed cabbage leaves. Also called jeyuk-bossam or kimchi-bossam.

name: Wrapped Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of quartered cabbages with kimchi seasonings spread between the layers of leaves and wrapped separately in a large cabbage leaf. The fist-sized bundles are put into jars and left to season together. When served, the individual bundles are put on dishes, unwrapped and eaten. This is a specialty of the Gaeseong region.

name: Puffer Fish (Swellfish / Globefish)
details: A stew made of putter fish, dubu (soybean curd tofu), soybean sprouts, minari (Korean parsley) and other vegetables, and spiced with red chili pepper paste and red chili pepper powder.

name: Raw Puffer Fish
details: Thin slices of raw putter fish prepared after removing the poisonous liver and roe. Raw putter fish is served with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Puffer Fish Soup
details: Soup of putter fish, white radish, Chinese cabbage, minari (Korean parsley), and other vegetables in a clear broth.

name: Braised Puffer Fish
details: Putter fish braised in soy sauce, garnished, and salted with pickled shrimp sauce.

name: Fried Rice
details: Cooked rice pan-fried with chopped meat and vegetables.

name: Deep-fried Vegetables Coated with Starch
details: Seaweed or vegetables coated with glutinous rice starch, dried, and deep-fried.

name: G.1.Stew
details: A spicy stew of wieners, luncheon meat, macaroni and vegetables. This dish originated from ingredients that could be scavenged from the U.S. military camps in Korea during the Korean War.

name: Chive
details: There are two kinds of chives: Korean and Chinese. Chinese chives are wider and mostly used in Chinese dishes. The chives used in Korea are flatter than Western chives and have a stronger flavor.

name: Chive Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of chives mixed with fish sauce, red chili pepper powder, crushed garlic and some glutinous rice starch.

name: Chive Pancake
details: Pan-fried fiat cakes made of chives mixed in a flour batter, often with green chili peppers and shelled clams.

name: Dried Pollack
details: Dried pollack is used as an ingredient in a variety of soups and side dishes. There are many grades but fish caught and dried in the winter is considered the best.

name: Grilled Dried Pollack
details: Dried pollack seasoned with soy sauce, or red chili pepper paste and grilled.

name: Seasoned Dried Pollack
details: Dried pollack shredded into thin strips and seasoned.

name: Seasoned Dried Pollack Flakes
details: Dried pollack shredded into very thin flakes and seasoned with soy sauce, sugar, oil, and sometimes red chili pepper powder for color.

name: Braised Dried Pollack
details: Dried pollack braised in soy sauce, green anions and garlic until the flavor is fully absorbed by the fish. Served as a side dish.

name: Simmered Dried Pollack
details: Seasoned dried pollack simmered over low heat in a small amount of water.

name: Dried Pollack Soup
details: A soup made of dried pollack shredded by hand in a clear broth with garlic, green onions and a beaten egg added just before serving.

name: Bulgogi (Korean Barbecue)
details: Thin slices of beef marinated in a mixture of soy sauce, sugar, green onions, garlic, black pepper, sesame seeds, and sesame oil and grilled at the table. Bulgogi is one of Korea's most popular beef dishes.

name: Bulgogi in Stone Pot
details: Marinated beef cooked in a hot stone or earthenware pot with vegetables, clear noodles and broth. A variation of bulgogi, this dish has been recently developed by restaurants as a way of serving bulgogi for one.

name: Bulgogi and Baby Octopus Hot Pot
details: A hot pot of marinated beef and spiced baby octopus cooked with vegetables in a broth.

name: Bulgogi Set Menu
details: A set menu of grilled marinated beef, rice, and some side dishes.

name: Braised Crusian Carp
details: Carp braised in a soybean paste (doenjang) broth.

name: Stuffed White Radish Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of whole white radishes with diagonal slits that are stuffed with sliced radish and seasonings.

name: Mixed Noodles
details: Cooked noodles mixed with vegetables, meat and a spicy sauce.

name: Mixed Buckwheat Noodles
details: Chilled buckwheat noodles mixed in a spicy sauce and topped with sliced cold meat, sliced Korean pear, cucumbers, and other vegetables.

name: Bibimbap (Rice Mixed with Vegetables and Beef)
details: One of the most popular Korean dishes, bibimbap consists of a bowl of rice topped with fresh and cooked vegetables and red chili pepper paste. Everything is mixed together before eating. Seasoned raw beef, grilled beef, or a fried egg can also be added. There are many styles and regional variations of this dish. The cities of Jeonju and Jinju are famous for their distinctive bibimbap and there are other variations such as hot stone pot (dolsot) bibimbap, soybean sprout bibimbap, and vegetable bibimbap. Goldongban is the royal court term for bibimbap.

name: Soybean Puree Stew
details: A stew made of the soybean puree that is left after making dubu (soybean curd / tofu). Sliced pork and / or vegetables are added to the stew while cooking.

name: Shaved Ice with Toppings
details: A refreshing summer snack made of shaved ice topped with sweet red bean, fruit, and sweetened condensed milk. ln accordance with the main topping, different variations are called pat-bingsu (sweet red bean), gwail-bingsu (fruit), and so on.

name: Mixed Ox Bones
details: Ox bones are used mainly to make soup stock. The chopped bones are soaked to eliminate any impurities and remaining blood, then are simmered in water for a long time to produce a milky broth.

name: Pan-fried Beef and Fish Brochette
details: Pan-fried skewers of marinated beef and fish.

name: Simmered Beef Shank
details: Beef shanks simmered for a long period with white radish, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, spices and soy sauce in a meat broth.

name: Deep-fried Sweet Rice Cookies
details: Rice cookies made of a glutinous rice flour dough cut into squares, deep-fried, and coated with puffed rice.

name: Beef and Vegetable Brochette (1)
details: Grilled skewers of beef and vegetables. The brochettes can also be dipped in flour and egg, then pan-fried.

name: Bibimbap with Wild Vegetables
details: A type of bibimbap made with seasoned wild leafy greens and root vegetables gathered in the mountains. The vegetables are seasoned, put on top of the rice, and then everything is mixed together with a spicy red pepper sauce before eating.

name: Jellied Apricots
details: Apricots that have been cooked in water, strained, and simmered in sugar or honey. Starch is added to make a jelly.

name: Grilled Pork Belly
details: Strips of pork belly (the same cut as bacon but not smoked) mixed with a spicy red chili pepper paste sauce and grilled, or grilled plain and dipped in a mixture of sesame oil and salt before eating.

name: Chicken Ginseng Soup
details: A soup made of a whole young chicken stuffed with ginseng, sticky rice, garlic, jujubes (Korean dates), and chestnuts, then cooked in a clear broth. With meat, vegetables, rice and hot soup all in one dish, this soup is popular for its wholesome flavor and health benefits.

name: Three Braised Delicacies
details: Seasoned beef, abalone, and mussels braised with carrots, onions and spices.

name: Lettuce Salad
details: A salad of lettuce leaves tossed in a seasoned soy sauce.

name: Rice Wrapped in Lettuce
details: Spoonfuls of rice wrapped in lettuce leaves, often with other vegetables such as green onions and crown daisy and pieces of fish or meat, with a mixed sauce of soybean paste (doenjang) and red chili pepper paste.

name: Pickled Shrimp
details: A salty fish sauce made of baby shrimp pickled in salt. This sauce is used to make kimchi and to season soups and other dishes with a salty flavor.

name: Deep-fried Shrimp
details: Shrimp coated in a flour and egg batter, then deep-fried.

name: Grilled Fresh Short Ribs
details: Beef short ribs grilled without being marinated first. Some restaurants use this name to refer to grilled ribs that were not frozen.

name: Ginger
details: Ginger is not only used to flavor food but also to make tea and traditional liquor.

name: Candied Ginger
details: Thin slices of ginger simmered in sugar and sweet syrup until candied.

name: Ginger Tea
details: A tea made of fresh ginger slices cooked in boiling water. Powdered instant versions are now widely available.

name: Peeled Fresh Chestnuts
details: Chestnuts peeled and served fresh.

name: Pan-fried Fish Fillets
details: Fish fillet coated in flour, dipped in egg, and pan-fried. Commonly used fish for this dish include halibut, cod, pollack and shrimp. Also called jeonyueo.

name: Raw Fish on Rice
details: Similar to Japanese sushi, thin slices of raw fish and a small amount of wasabi are placed on top of bite-sized lumps of white rice that has been cooked with a little vinegar and sugar.

name: Raw Fish
details: Thin slices of fresh fish served with mustard soy sauce or vinegared red chili pepper paste and eaten raw.

name: Fresh Vegetable Salad
details: Side dishes made of fresh salad vegetables tossed in a seasoned dressing.

name: Chinese Cabbage and Radish Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of pre-salted Chinese cabbages and white radishes cut into pieces then mixed in kimchi spices or fish sauce.

name: Mixed Stew
details: A stew made with a wide range of ingredients, usually with a spicy stew base. This dish originates from home-made stews using whatever ingredients were available at the time.

name: Hangover Soup with Ox Blood
details: A soup made of bean sprouts, fiddleheads, other vegetables, and ox blood in an ox bone broth with soybean paste (doenjang) and red chili pepper paste. This soup is popular as a remedy for hangovers.

name: Ox Bone Soup
details: A milky soup made by simmering the bones, head, and other parts of the cow for a long period.

name: Pan-fried Beef Patries (1)
details: Thin square patties of minced beef mixed with seasonings and grilled.

name: Pickled Sea Urchin Roe
details: Yellow sea urchin roe pickled in salt.

name: Sea Urchin Soup
details: A soup made with sea urchin and usually seaweed. A regional specialty of Jeju-do.

name: Spicy Conch
details: Parboiled conch removed from the shell, sliced, and dressed with a spicy vinegar sauce.

name: Parboiled Conch
details: Slices of parboiled conch served as a hoe (raw fish) dish with vinegar and soy sauce or vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Thin Noodles
details: Thin white noodles (similar to Japanese somyeon) cooked in water and added to a clear broth.

name: Stuffed Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of vegetables such as cucumber, white radish, eggplant, or chili pepper that are slit lengthwise and stuffed with spicy filling.

name: Soju
details: A clear, distilled liquor made of rice, sweet potatoes and other ingredients similar to vodka. Along with makgeolli, this is the most popular alcoholic beverage in Korea and is also the base liquor for many other drinks. The alcohol content is 20-25%.

name: Pine Mushroom
details: Pine mushrooms have a distinct flavor and scent and are harvested from pine forests in the fall.

name: Pine Mushroom Rice
details: Rice cooked with pine mushrooms.

name: Sauteed Pine Mushroom
details: Thinly sliced pine mushrooms lightly seasoned and sauteed with beef, onions and the white stems of green onions.

name: Pine Mushroom and Beef Brochette
details: Grilled brochettes of seasoned pine mushrooms and beef.

name: Pine Mushroom Hot Pot
details: A hot pot of pine mushrooms, seasoned beef, minari (Korean parsley), and other vegetables cooked in broth.

name: Simmered Pine Mushroom with Beef Stuffing
details: Pine mushrooms with stems cut lengthwise and stuffed with a beef filling. The stuffed mushrooms are simmered with other ingredients such as white radish, chestnuts, and gingko nuts.

name: Half-moon Rice Cake
details: Half-moon shaped rice cakes made of rice flour dough stuffed with various fillings. A traditional festival dish served on Chuseok, the Korean harvest festival.

name: Beef
details: Korean cuisine incorporates almost all parts of the cow, including sirloin, loin, shank, brisket, rump, short ribs, blood, bones, knees, hoof, tail, head, small intestines, tripe, and tongue. Lean meats such as short ribs, sirloin and loin are grilled. Shank, brisket and ribs are braised and used for soups. Neck, shoulder and rump are used for bulgogi. Shoulder and shank are served seasoned and raw. Rump and round are used for brochettes and are dried to make jerky. Rump, shoulder and round are simmered in soy sauce.

name: Clear Beef Soup (2)
details: A clear soup made of slices of beef stir-fried with some salt, pepper, garlic and other seasonings then cooked in water to make a broth. Often used as the base for noodle or dumpling soups.

name: Beef Brochette
details: Grilled brochettes of marinated slices of beef, green onions and mushrooms.

name: Grilled Beef
details: Pieces of beef lightly seasoned with salt and grilled.

name: Beef Hot Pot
details: A hot pot of beef with vegetables cooked together in a little broth. This dish is usually cooked and served at the table.

name: Deep-fried Beef
details: Slices of beef dipped in a flour batter and deep-fried.

name: Braised Oxtail
details: Pieces of oxtail mixed with spices and seasonings and braised in broth over low heat for a long time.

name: Rice Cake with Beans and Chestnuts
details: Steamed rice cake made of glutinous rice flour, sugar, chestnuts, jujubes (Korean dates), and beans. Served in thin slices.

name: Pressed Ox Head
details: Ox head meat that has been boiled, taken off the bone, and pressed to remove excess liquid. Served in slices.

name: Poached Eggs
details: Eggs cooked lightly in boiling water.

name: Candied Fresh Ginseng
details: Pieces of ginseng simmered in sugar water then candied with sweet syrup or honey.

name: Millet Balls
details: Millet flour cakes formed into balls, cooked in water, then rolled in ground red beans or beans. Also called susu-pattteok.

name: Millet Pancake
details: Pan-fried, half-moon shaped millet cakes with red bean filling. Also called chalsusu-jijim.

name: Boiled Beef Slices
details: Pieces of beef cooked in boiling water, then cut into thin slices and served hot.

name: Cinnamon Punch with Dried Persimmon
details: A sweet punch is made of ginger, cinnamon sticks and sugar simmered together in water. Dried persimmons are added after cooling and the punch is served with a few pine nuts floating on top. One of Korea's most popular dessert drinks.

name: Sujebi Soup
details: A soup with summer squash, other vegetables, and small dumplings. The dumplings are made of flour dough that is hand broken into little pieces and dropped into the hot soup right before serving.

name: Glazed Fruits and Nuts
details: Fruits and nuts, especially chestnuts, jujubes (Korean dates), and ginger, that have been simmered in honey, sweet syrup and sugar until glazed.

name: Mung Bean Sprout Namul
details: A side dish of mung bean sprouts blanched in salt water and seasoned.

name: Korean-style Blood Sausage
details: A sausage of pork blood, vegetables, and rice or noodles.

name: Blood Sausage Soup
details: A soup made of cabbage and sliced blood sausage in an ox bone broth.

name: Soft Dubu
details: Soft dubu (soybean curd / tofu) before thickeners are added to harden the curd to its usual texture.

name: Spicy Soft Dubu Stew
details: A spicy red stew with soft dubu (soybean curd / tofu), soybean paste (doenjang), fish sauce, clams, summer squash, and some meat.

name: Turnip Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of turnips (smaller than the usual white radish used in Korea). This is a specialty of the Ganghwado region.

name: Browned Rice Tea
details: A tea made of the browned rice from the bottom of the rice pot. Water is poured into the pot and boiled until the slightly burnt rice on the bottom softens and mixes with the water. This popular drink is served hot after meals.

name: Charcoal Barbecued Beef Short Ribs
details: Beef short ribs grilled at the table over charcoal. The meat can be served in two ways: Marinated ribs are called yangnyeom (seasoned) galbi and plain ribs without seasoning are called saenggalbi.

name: Spinach Soup
details: A soup made with spinach in beef or clam broth.

name: Dried Radish Leaves
details: Leaves of white radish or Chinese cabbage that have been dried to preserve them through the winter and used later in soups, stews or seasoned side dishes.

name: Cooked Dried Radish Leaf Namul
details: Dried radish or Chinese cabbage leaves that have been cooked in water, seasoned, and sauteed lightly in oil. Ground dried anchovies or sesames are some of the unique seasonings used to flavor this dish.

name: Dried Radish Leaf Stew
details: A stew of dried radish or Chinese cabbage leaves that have been boiled in water and added to a soybean paste (doenjang) broth.

name: Dried Radish Leaf Soup
details: A soup of dried radish leaves or Chinese cabbage leaves that have been cooked in water and added to a thick soybean paste broth.

name: Layered Rice Cake
details: A rice cake made with white rice flour, layered with red bean filling and steamed.

name: Rice Punch
details: A traditional sweet dessert drink made of malt and rice. When served, there are often rice grains floating on top. Also called dansul.

name: Royal Hot Pot
details: A hot pot of seafood, fine meats and vegetables in broth cooked at the table in a brass pot that is kept warm by a small charcoal fire underneath. Traditionally served at the royal court.

name: Ssari Mushroom
details: Coral mushroom. The caps are said to taste like chicken and the stems like abalone.

name: Vegetable Leaf Wraps
details: A method of wrapping spoonfuls of cooked rice, grilled meat, or raw fish in various leafy vegetables, such as lettuce, crown daisy, sesame leaves, kelp (seaweed), and cooked pumpkin leaves.

name: Rice with Vegetable Leaf Wraps
details: A dish with rice accompanied by various leafy vegetables, cooked or fresh, such as lettuce, crown daisy, steamed pumpkin leaves, sesame leaves, and kale.

name: Ssangwhacha (Medicinal Tea)
details: A health tea made with medicinal herbs and brewed for a long period. Such teas are generally taken as a cold remedy.

name: Spicy Mandarin Fish Stew
details: A spicy stew made of mandarin fish, white radish, green chili peppers, crown daisy, green onions, and garlic in a broth seasoned with red chili pepper powder or red chili pepper paste.

name: Crown Daisy
details: A herbal leaf vegetable with a relatively strong scent which is used by itself, cooked and seasoned as a side dish, or added to fish soups and other stews. lt is also often used for rice wraps.

name: Sweet Rice Balls with Mugwort
details: Small rice cake balls made of glutinous rice flour and mugwort, a green vegetable with a distinctive aroma. These rice cakes are rolled in ground red beans.

name: Mugwort Soup
details: A soup made of mugwort in a beef or dried anchovy broth with soybean paste (doenjang). The mugwort is often tossed in some soybean flour to bring out its flavor before it is added to the soup.

name: Mugwort Noodles
details: Noodles made of wheat flour and ground mugwort to give them a distinctive flavor and green color.

name: Mugwort Rice Cake
details: Dark green rice cakes made of rice flour and mugwort. Mugwort can also be added to buckwheat, barley or sweet potato starch to make similar cakes.

name: Wild Lettuce
details: A wild leafy green with edible roots and long, thin leaves that are slightly bitter. This is most commonly harvested from the mountains in the spring.

name: Wild Lettuce Namul
details: A side dish made of wild lettuce which has been first soaked in salt water to remove its bitterness, then is seasoned with soy sauce, red chili pepper paste, roasted sesame seeds, green anions and garlic.

name: Spicy Angler Fish with Soybean Sprouts
details: Angler fish simmered with soybean sprouts, minari (Korean parsley), and a seasoning of green onion, chili peppers, soy sauce, garlic and sugar.

name: Angler Fish Stew
details: A stew of angler fish in a soybean paste (doenjang) broth with dried anchovies.

name: Mallow Soup with Soybean Paste
details: A soup of mallow (a thick, dark leafy green that has to be cleaned thoroughly to soften it before cooking) in a soybean paste (doenjang) broth. Sometimes the soup is thickened with red chili pepper paste or flavored with dried shrimps.

name: Andong Soju
details: A rice liquor that is distilled several times in the distiller used to make soju. The unique method of making this liquor originated in the city of Andong.

name: Andong Braised Chicken
details: Originally from the Andong region, this dish consists of chicken, chili peppers, potatoes, clear noodles, leeks and carrots braised in a spicy sauce of garlic, sweet syrup and soy sauce.

name: Dishes for Drinks
details: ln Korea, ail alcoholic drinks are served with dry snacks or side dishes. The dry snacks include dried fish or meat similar to beef jerky, nuts, and dried fruits. The most common side dishes are pancakes (usually with green onions or seafood in them), other pan-fried delicacies, and different kinds of soup dishes.

name: Spicy Fish Roe Stew
details: A stew with pollack, cod or sea bream roe, spiced with red chili pepper powder, garlic, ginger and green onions. Altang can also refer to a pickled spicy pollack roe stew.

name: Stuffed Piglet
details: A two-month old piglet stuffed with sticky rice, chestnuts, jujubes (Korean dates), garlic, green onions, ginger, and walnuts and simmered for a long time.

name: Deep-fried Honey Cookies
details: Deep-fried cookies made from a dough of wheat flour, sesame oil, soju, and honey. The cookies are pressed in a wood mold into round or flower shapes, then deep-fried and dipped in honey.

name: Sweet Rice with Nuts and Jujubes
details: Steamed sticky rice made with chestnuts, jujubes (Korean dates), honey, pine nuts and cinnamon. This dish is a sweet snack similar to rice cake.

name: Clear Rice Wine (1)
details: A rice wine made from steamed rice that has gone through several fermentation stages. lngredients in traditional medicine are also added, giving this liquor its literal name of

name: Beef Tripe Soup
details: A soup made of beef tripe simmered for a long period with ginger, garlic, green onions and other ingredients. This soup is said to be an aphrodisiac.

name: Grilled Beef Tripe and Intestines
details: Beef tripe and intestines mixed in a spicy sauce and grilled. The black outside layer of the tripe is discarded and only the white inside is used. Sometimes the tripe is grilled plain and served with a sauce for dipping.

name: Seasoned Soy Sauce
details: A variation of soy sauce for the table or cooking. This mixture is made by adding green onions, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, and black pepper or red chili pepper powder to soy sauce.

name: Spicy Seasoned Crab
details: Crabs marinated in a spicy sauce with a large amount of red chili pepper powder.

name: Beef Tripe with Spicy Sauce
details: Cooked beef tripe mixed with a spicy mixture of soy sauce, red chili pepper powder, green onions, garlic, sugar, sesame oil and sesame salt.

name: Chopped Beef Tripe Soup
details: A soup made from finely chopped beef tripe that is simmered for a long time to produce a milky broth. This soup is very nutritious and is often prepared for the sick and elderly.

name: Pollack and Beef Soup
details: A soup with patties made of minced beef, dubu (soybean curd

name: Pickled Oyster
details: Fresh oysters pickled in salt, red chili pepper powder, and crushed garlic.

name: Fish Fillet Dumplings
details: Thin fish fillets folded like dumplings, stuffed with minced and seasoned beef, and steamed.

name: Boiled Meat Platter
details: Slices of cooked beef and some beef broth served in a shallow brass dish. Noodles can also be added. This dish is a traditional specialty of the Pyeongan-do region in North Korea.

name: Steamed Fish Fillet, Beef and Vegetable Mix
details: Thin fish fillets stuffed with beef, shiitake mushrooms, cucumbers and carrots, then coated in starch and steamed.

name: Lotus Roots
details: Lotus roots are pan-fried, made into porridge, and also dipped in honey to make sweets.

name: Pan-fried Lotus Roots
details: Lotus roots sliced into flat, round pieces, coated in a flour and egg batter, and pan-fried.

name: Candied Lotus Roots
details: Round slices of lotus root, simmered in sugar water until candied.

name: Glazed Lotus Roots
details: Round slices of lotus root simmered in soy sauce, sugar and rice wine until glazed. Garnished with sesame seeds.

name: Young Summer Radish Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of young summer radish (smaller roots with larger leaves). This kimchi has a lot of water and is lightly seasoned.

name: Chilled Buckwheat Noodles with Radish Kimchi
details: Buckwheat noodles served in a chilled broth with chopped radish kimchi.

name: Grilled Ox Heart
details: Thin slices of ox heart seasoned with salt and spices and grilled.

name: Malt Candy
details: A sweet, sticky candy made of hardened maltose syrup and sweet glutinous rice. This candy has the texture of toffee.

name: Malt Toffee
details: Traditional sweet treats made of nuts or cereals, such as peas, beans, pine nuts, peanuts and sesame seeds, mixed with warm maltose syrup and left to harden.

name: Young Chicken and Ginseng Soup
details: A soup made of a whole young chicken stuffed with ginseng, sweet rice, jujubes (Korean dates) and other ingredients. The stuffed chicken is simmered until tender.

name: Five Grain Rice
details: A mixed rice with corn, red beans, beans, white rice, glutinous rice, and glutinous millet. Traditionally, this is the rice served on the first full moon of the lunar calendar.

name: Stuffed Ogol Chicken Soup
details: A soup made of a whole ogol chicken (a chicken with dark meat and bones) stuffed with garlic, glutinous rice, jujubes (Korean dates), chestnuts, and other ingredients and simmered until tender. This soup is considered a delicacy due ta its health effects.

name: Roast Duck
details: A duck stuffed with ginger and green onions and hung by its tail to be roasted.

name: Duck Stew
details: A stew of duck slowly simmered with onions, garlic, radishes, and other vegetables.

name: Omija
details: The fruit of the Chinese magnolia vine, used in teas, wine, punches, and as a medicine. Omija literally means

name: Omija Tea
details: A tea made of omija (the fruit of the Chinese magnolia vine). Served hot or cold with honey and garnished with pine nuts.

name: Omija Punch
details: A fruit punch made of omija (fruit of the Chinese magnolia vine), sugar and various fruits. Azalea petals can also be added.

name: Small Abalone
details: A shellfish similar to a small abalone. lt is often pickled in salt or put in stews and porridges.

name: Pickled Small Abalone
details: Small abalones pickled in salt. A regional specialty of Jeju-do.

name: Braised Small Abalone
details: Small abalones seasoned in spices and braised.

name: Chilled Cucumber Soup
details: Julienned cucumbers, seasoned and salted, then added to a chilled vinegary soup.

name: Seasoned Cucumbers
details: Sliced cucumbers lightly salted and mixed with julienned white radish, red chili pepper powder, green onions, garlic and ginger. Also called oi-saengchae.

name: Sauteed Cucumbers
details: Sliced cucumbers lightly salted and squeezed by hand to remove excess liquid, then sauteed with minced pork and seasonings.

name: Stuffed Cucumbers
details: Cucumbers cut into three or four sections, slit lengthwise and lightly salted. After lightly sauteeing the cucumbers, each section is stuffed with beef, egg, sliced mushrooms and others ingredients. A mixture of water, sugar and vinegar is poured over the stuffed cucumbers to give a sweet, vinegary flavor.

name: Stuffed Cucumber Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of cucumbers cut into three to four sections, slit lengthwise, and stuffed with a filling of green onions, garlic, ginger and red chili pepper powder.

name: Cucumbers Pickled in Soy Sauce or Red Chili Pepper Paste
details: Salted cucumbers pickled in a mixture of vinegar, soy sauce and sugar, or put into a jar of red chili pepper paste or soybean paste (doenjang). Keeps for a long period and is served as a side dish.

name: Cucumbers Pickled in Salt Water
details: Cucumbers pickled by pouring hot salt water over them and letting them sit for a long time.

name: Squid
details: Squid are eaten fresh or dried in the open air.

name: Grilled Squid
details: Fresh squid coated with red chili pepper paste and soybean paste (doenjang) and grilled. When cooked with red chili pepper paste, this dish is called squid bulgogi.

name: Squid over Rice
details: Squid and vegetables stir-fried in a red chili pepper sauce and served on rice.

name: Seasoned Squid
details: Blanched squid slices and vegetables mixed with a red chili pepper sauce.

name: Parboiled Squid
details: Parboiled squid slices served with vinegared red chili pepper paste sauce.

name: Stuffed Squid
