details: A cleaned squid stuffed with a mixture of dubu (soybean curd

name: Pickled Squid
details: Slices of fresh squid pickled in salt with red chili pepper powder.

name: Seasoned Dried Squid Strips
details: Thin strips of dried squid mixed in a spicy red chili pepper sauce or seasoned soy sauce.

name: Sauteed Dried Squid Strips
details: Thin strips of dried squid sauteed with soy sauce or red chili pepper paste.

name: Raw Squid
details: Fresh squid sliced and served raw with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Tilefish
details: Tilefish has a fresh and slightly sweet, buttery flavor.

name: Grilled Tilefish
details: Tilefish sprinkled with salt and grilled.

name: Tilefish and Seaweed Soup
details: A soup made of tilefish fillets cooked with seaweed. A regional specialty of Jeju-do.

name: Rice Porridge with Tilefish
details: Rice porridge with tilefish. The fish is added to the rice and simmered until thick.

name: Buckwheat Noodle Soup
details: A warm buckwheat noodle soup in a beef broth served with kimchi. Also refers to all hot noodles.

name: Chicken Soup with Rice
details: Cooked rice in a chicken broth topped with seasoned chicken. A specialty of the Pyeongan-do region in North Korea.

name: Braised Radish with Beef and Mushroom
details: Large radish pieces simmered over low heat with seasoned beef slices and mushrooms. Some variations use pork or fish instead of beef. This dish is popular during autumn when radishes are in season.

name: Pan-fried Beef Patties (2)
details: Patties of minced beef, dubu (soybean curd

name: Fish or Meatball Soup
details: A soup of small beef, pork, or chicken meatballs and fish in a clear meat broth. The balls are dipped in egg before they are put in the soup.

name: Chicken and Crusian Carp Soup
details: A soup of chicken and crusian carp with shiitake mushrooms, jujubes (Korean dates), and chestnuts. This soup is said to be an aphrodisiac.

name: Chinese Cabbage Soup (2)
details: A soup made of the green leaves of the Chinese cabbage in a soybean paste (doenjang) broth.

name: Rump Stew with Vegetables
details: A stew of beef rump with shiitake mushrooms, white radish, chestnuts and gingko nuts mixed in a seasoned soy sauce. The ingredients are simmered over a long period until the meat has absorbed the full flavor of its sauce.

name: Mud Snail and Soybean Paste Stew
details: A soybean paste (doenjang) stew with mud snails and vegetables.

name: Braised Mud Snails
details: Mud snails braised with bean sprouts and vegetables in a dried anchovy broth thickened with flour.

name: Boiled Beef Tongue
details: Beef tongue is a delicacy in Korea. lt is boiled, thinly sliced, and served with other meats and a dipping sauce or added to special soups.

name: Burdock
details: A root vegetable often served as a side dish with soy sauce.

name: Glazed Burdock
details: Burdock simmered in soy sauce, sesame oil, and sugar until glazed and garnished with sesame seeds and red chili pepper threads.

name: Toppings
details: Toppings or garnishes, such as fruit or dried meats, used to decorate and add flavor to meal dishes or rice cakes.

name: Honey Punch with Sweet Rice Balls
details: A traditional drink made of water and honey with small rice cake balls filled with jujubes (Korean dates) and citron peel.

name: Day Lily Namul
details: Blanched day lily stems seasoned with soybean paste (doenjang), red chili pepper paste, green onions, garlic, sesame oil, and sesame salt. This is a spring dish.

name: Deep-fried Grain Cookies
details: A variety of traditional cookies made with different kinds of flour and pan-fried or deep-fried. Each variety of cookie has a different name according to its ingredients and how it is cooked. Also called yumilgwa.

name: Glazed Citron
details: Citron peel cooked in water then simmered in sugar water until glazed. The citron fruit is added during the glazing process.

name: Citron Tea
details: A tea made by adding hot water to a mixture of citron peel and honey or sugar syrup resembling marmalade.

name: Spicy Beef and Leek Soup
details: A soup made with beef, green onions, fiddleheads, and other vegetables in a spicy red broth seasoned with red chili pepper powder, garlic, and soy sauce.

name: Dried Beef Jerky
details: Thin slices of beef marinated in soy sauce, black pepper, sugar and other seasonings, then dried in the shade. Often served as a dried snack with alcohol.

name: Korean Beef Steak Tartare
details: Thinly sliced raw beef seasoned with soy sauce, salt and sesame oil. Similar to steak tartare, this dish is usually served with julienned Korean pear and garlic.

name: Stone Pot Bibimbap with Beef Tartare
details: A bibimbap served in a hot stone pot with vegetables and seasoned beef tartare over rice. When served, ail the ingredients are mixed together with a spicy red chili pepper sauce in the sizzling pot.

name: Mashed Chestnut Sweets
details: Mashed cooked chestnuts mixed with cinnamon and sugar, molded into chestnut shapes, and rolled in ground pine nuts or cinnamon.

name: YulmuTea
details: A hot drink made by adding roasted ground Job' s tears (this white powder has a nutty flavor) into hot water with sugar or honey.

name: Igangju
details: A liquor made by adding pear juice, ginger juice, honey and water to soju. This liquor is typically produced in February according to the lunar calendar and is famous in Jeonju in Jeolla-do in southwestern Korea and Hwanghae-do in North Korea.

name: Ginseng
details: A root famous for its medicinal properties that is also used for cooking. Fresh ginseng is called susam and is served sliced as a special appetizer or dessert. lt can also be made into a juice. Dried ginseng is most often used to make tea or is added to dishes such as soups.

name: Candied Ginseng
details: Sliced ginseng simmered until soft, then glazed in water with honey, sweet syrup, sugar and salt until candied.

name: Ginseng Wine
details: Liquor fermented with ground ginseng or flavored by adding a pouch of ginseng to wine that has already been made.

name: Ginseng Tea
details: A tea traditionally made by simmering ginseng, jujubes (Korean dates), and peeled chestnuts. Recently, an instant powdered version has become widely available. Ginseng tea is served with pine nuts on top.

name: Sweet Rice Cake
details: A rice cake made of steamed glutinous rice that is beaten to make a firm, sticky dough. The rice cake is cut into squares and coated in ground beans or black sesame seeds to prevent them from sticking together and give them flavor.

name: Chilled Chicken Soup
details: A soup made of chopped chicken, minari(Korean parsley) stems, julienned egg garnish, and ground sesame seeds in a chilled chicken broth.

name: Braised Carp
details: Seasoned carp braised or cooked in boiling water.

name: Raw Carp
details: Freshly cleaned carp filleted, sliced thinly, and served raw.

name: Grilled Damselfish
details: Damselfish seasoned with salt or soy sauce and grilled.

name: Raw Damselfish in Chilled Broth
details: Thinly sliced raw damselfish seasoned with sesame leaves, green chili peppers and chives and served in a seasoned chilied broth. A specialty of Jeju-do.

name: Salted Fish
details: Various types of fish that have been cleaned, salted and preserved. Served as side dishes.

name: Sparrow's Tongue Green Tea
details: A green tea made with the new leaves of that year. Jakseol literally means

name: Banquet Noodles
details: A simple noodle dish of thin wheat noodles in a clear broth and topped with julienned egg garnish, sauteed beef, julienned summer squash and mushrooms. This dish was traditionally served at large banquets and feasts.

name: Mixed Brochette
details: Colorful brochettes made of beef, abalone, sea cucumber, shiitake mushrooms, bellflower root (doraji), and carrots. The ingredients are cut into strips of similar lengths, marinated and pan-fried separately, and put together on skewers.

name: Beef and Vegetable Brochette (2)
details: Brochettes of beef, liver, tripe, green onions and mushrooms. The ingredients are cut into similar lengths, pan-fried with seasonings, and put together on skewers.

name: Japchae (Clear Noodles Stir-fried with Vegetables)
details: Vegetables and beef pan-fried separately then mixed with clear noodles, soy sauce, and other seasonings. One of the most popular party dishes, this dish is often seen at special banquets.

name: Pine Nut Cookies
details: Cookies made with rice flour that are deep-fried, dipped in sweet syrup, and topped with pine nuts.

name: Pine Nut Candy
details: A sweet treat made of pine nuts mixed with maltose syrup, sugar and honey and left to harden.

name: Pine Nut Porridge
details: A rice porridge cooked with pine nuts.

name: Rice in Beef Soup
details: Cooked rice in a hot beef broth, often topped with beef brochettes and julienned egg garnish. This dish originates in Seoul.

name: Soy Sauce Kimchi
details: A kimchi made with soy sauce. The young leaves in the heart of the cabbage are sliced and mixed with julienned white radish, red chili threads, garlic, green onions, ginger, minari (Korean parsley), and mushrooms. Ali the ingredients are then seasoned together with soy sauce.

name: Pan-fried Soybean Paste Patties
details: Thin pan-fried patties made with glutinous rice flour, soybean paste (doenjang), minced meat, green onions, garlic, black pepper and sesame seeds.

name: Grilled and Braised Beef
details: Beef fillet tenderized with small incisions, seasoned and grilled, then braised in soy sauce and spices.

name: Pickled Vegetables
details: Vegetables pickled in soybean paste (doenjang) or red chili pepper paste and served as a side dish. The most commonly used vegetables include white radish, cucumber, scallions, Korean melons (small yellow melons with a smooth rind), soybean leaves, and green chili peppers.

name: Grilled Freshwater Eel
details: Eel marinated in a sauce of red chili pepper paste, soy sauce, sugar, green onions, garlic and sesame oil and grilled. The eel can also be lightly steamed, coated with a mixture of soy sauce and sugar, and then grilled.

name: Beef Chunks Braised in Soy Sauce
details: Pieces of beef braised in soy sauce and water until the meat turns dark and salty. The meat is then cut into smaller pieces for serving. This is one of the most traditional and popular beef side dishes.

name: Small Clam Soup
details: Small clams, steamed and shelled, cooked in a clam broth and seasoned with salt. A specialty of Gyeongsang-do in southeastern Korea.

name: Brochette
details: Meats and vegetables thinly sliced and put on skewers, dipped in flour and egg, and pan-fried.

name: Pan-fried Delicacies
details: Small patties of minced meat or chopped vegetables dipped in flour and egg, then pan-fried.

name: Hot Pot
details: A dish of broth, meat, vegetables, and a variety of seasonings and spices cooked at the table in a wide, shallow pot.

name: Rice Porridge with Abalone
details: A savory rice porridge cooked with minced abalone.

name: Simmered Abalone
details: Whole or chopped abalone with beef, sea cucumber, octopus, mussels, mushrooms and spices simmered in seasoned soy sauce and honey.

name: Abalone in Soy Sauce
details: Abalone simmered over low heat in a mix of soy sauce, sugar and black pepper.

name: Raw Abalone
details: Fresh or blanched abalone thinly sliced and served raw with a dipping sauce of either soy sauce and vinegar or vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Jeonju-style Bibimbap
details: A mixed rice dish with a wide variety of blanched and seasoned vegetables, minced beef, and a fried egg served on a bowl of rice, ail mixed together with red chili pepper paste before eating. A popular dish originating in the city of Jeonju.

name: Patterned Rice Cake
details: White rice cakes rolled fiat, pressed with patterned molds, and cut into small squares. The patterned rice cakes are then brushed with oil.

name: Pickled Seafood
details: Sauce made of various kinds of fish or seafood that have been pickled in salt and fermented. This sauce can be served as a side dish or used as a seasoning for other dishes.

name: Pickled Shrimp Stew
details: A stew of pollack roe and dubu (soybean curd / tofu) seasoned with red chili pepper in a pickled shrimp broth.

name: Candied Fruits or Roots
details: Traditional sweet treats made of fruits or roots candied in honey or syrup.

name: Set Menu
details: The set menu of a restaurant; usually the specialty of the house.

name: Cooked Pork
details: Pork. Also refers to thinly sliced cooked pork.

name: Noodles in Clam Broth
details: Home-style noodles made of wheat or bean flour cooked in a clear clam broth.

name: Pickled Small Clams
details: Shelled clams pickled in salt. Served as a side dish.

name: Clam Soup (2)
details: Soup with clams in their shells and vegetables in a clam broth, seasoned with red chili pepper powder.

name: Grilled Yellow Croaker
details: Croaker salted and grilled.

name: Spicy Yellow Croaker Stew
details: A spicy red stew with croaker, beef and vegetables.

name: Pickled Yellow Croaker
details: Croaker pickled in salt to make a thick fish sauce.

name: Braised Yellow Croaker
details: Croaker braised in seasoned soy sauce, green onions and garlic.

name: Mashed Jujube Sweets
details: Steamed and mashed jujubes (Korean dates) mixed with sugar and molded back into their original shape. The balls are rolled in ground pine nuts to hold their shape and prevent them from sticking to each other.

name: Rice Ball Pasta Soup
details: Beef broth soup with rice pasta. A specialty of the Gaeseong region.

name: Soy Sauce Braised Dishes
details: These braised dishes are made by simmering meat or fish in soy sauce and other seasonings.

name: Glazed Pig's Feet
details: Pig's feet cooked in soy sauce, sugar, ginger and garlic until glazed.

name: Ox Foot Soup
details: A soup of ox feet and beef shank simmered for a long time.

name: Pressed Ox Feet
details: Ox feet simmered until the meat comes off the bones. The meat is pressed and served thinly sliced with vinegar and soy sauce.

name: Baby Squid
details: Smaller than baby octopus, baby squid is usually parboiled and served with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Grilled Beef with Salt and Sesame Oil
details: Strips of beef rubbed with salt and sesame oil and grilled.

name: Pan-fried Sweet Rice Cake Coated with Honey
details: Rice cakes made of glutinous rice flour and natural colorings, stuffed with fillings such as mushrooms, jujubes (Korean dates) and chestnuts, and pan-fried. The fried cakes are dusted with sugar or dipped in honey.

name: Porridge
details: Porridge made of rice or other grains simmered in water until thick. Served as a main dish or in smaller portions as an appetizer.

name: Sauteed Bamboo Shoots
details: Bamboo shoots sauteed with pork, green chili peppers, onions, and seasonings.

name: Stuffed Bamboo Shoots
details: Bamboo shoots slit lengthwise, stuffed with seasoned beef and mushrooms, and simmered in broth.

name: Julienned Bamboo Shoots
details: Bamboo shoots cooked in water, thinly sliced, and mixed with vegetables, soy sauce and vinegar. The ingredients may be stir-fried with minced pheasant meat and seasoned with salt instead of soy sauce.

name: Parboiled Bamboo Shoots
details: Blanched young bamboo shoots cut into thin, wide slices and served with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Bamboo Salt
details: A flavored salt made by filling a hollow bamboo stem that has been cut into sections with plain salt. The sections are then scorched in a hot oven and the salt is removed for use. This salt is said to have a superior taste and medicinal benefits.

name: Rice Wine Cake
details: Steamed rice cakes made with white rice flour and rice wine. The wine ferments the dough and gives a tangy taste to the cakes. The tops of these white, fluffy cakes are colorfully garnished. Also called sultteok (wine cake).

name: Egg Garnish
details: Egg whites and yolk beaten together or separately, then pan-fried very thinly. The cooked egg is julienned or cut into diamonds, and is used as a topping or garnish for many dishes.

name: Azalea Liquor
details: A sweet liquor made by adding azalea petals and sugar to soju. Also called dugyeonju.

name: Pan-fried Cake with Azaleas
details: Small pan-fried fiat rice cakes decorated with azalea flowers. Also called dugyeonhwajeon.

name: Azalea Punch
details: Azalea petals coated in starch, blanched, then added to a sugared omija (fruit of the Chinese magnolia vine) punch.

name: Pickled Radish
details: Autumn white radishes pickled whole in salt and kept until the following summer.

name: Spring Onion Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of lightly salted spring onions mixed with kimchi seasonings.

name: Stew
details: Thicker and more strongly flavored than soups, stews can be categorized by the main seasoning (red chili pepper paste stew, soybean paste (doenjang) stew, or pickled shrimp stew) or by their main ingredient (fish stew, dubu stew, or meat stew).

name: Steamed Dumplings
details: Dumplings cooked in a steamer.

name: Braised, Simmered or Steamed Dishes
details: The main ingredients, either meat or fish, are seasoned and simmered until the liquid is reduced and the ingredients take on the full flavor of the seasoning.

name: Cooked Sweet Rice
details: Cooked sweet rice with red beans, jujubes (Korean dates), and chestnuts. Sugar, soy sauce and sesame oil are added to bring out the flavor.

name: Sesame Oil
details: Oil pressed from roasted sesame seeds. One of the main seasonings in Korean cooking.

name: Sesame (Seeds)(2)
details: Sesame seeds are an indispensable ingredient in Korean cooking. They are either roasted and used directly or ground with a little salt.

name: Cham Namul
details: A wild leafy green with a strong scent, blanched or served fresh with various seasonings as a side dish.

name: Korean Honey Melon
details: A small, oval melon with a smooth, yellow rind and white ridges running lengthwise. Along with the watermelon, this is one of the most common summer fruits.

name: Sweet Rice
details: Sweet rice is stickier than plain white rice and is often used to make rice cake.

name: Pan-fried Sweet Rice Cake with Fillings
details: Round, fiat cakes made with glutinous rice flour that are pan-fried, folded in half, and stuffed with a variety of fillings.

name: Pickled Pollack Innards
details: Pollack innards cleaned and preserved in a sauce of red chili pepper powder, garlic and ginger. After fermentation, this dish becomes a salty side dish.

name: Rice Porridge with Vegetables
details: A rice porridge made with vegetables such as summer squash, green onions, bean sprouts, and pumpkin.

name: Deep-fried Vegetables
details: Vegetables dipped in a flour batter and deep-fried.

name: Beef Tripe Tartare
details: Beef tripe washed clean with salt then cut into thin strips and served raw. The pieces are dipped in a mixture of salt, black pepper and sesame oil before eating.

name: Sea Staghorn
details: A type of sea plant used as a topping for traditional water kimchi. lt can also be blanched, then seasoned and served as a side dish.

name: Cheonggukjang (Extra Strong Soybean Paste) Stew
details: A stew made with a thick soybean paste called cheonggukjang (similar to Japanese natto) with dubu (soybean curd / tofu), fully fermented kimchi, and pork. This paste is thicker and has a stronger smell than the regular soybean paste (doenjang). Also called dambukjang-jjigae.

name: Grilled Herring
details: Herring sprinkled with salt or marinated in a spiced soy sauce and grilled.

name: Clear Rice Wine (2)
details: A clear, refined rice wine made from a thicker rice wine that has been strained several times. This type of rice wine is similar to Japanese sake.

name: Vinegared Soy Sauce
details: A mixture of soy sauce and vinegar. This tangy dipping sauce is served with fish dishes or pan-fried vegetables and meat patties.

name: Red Chili Pepper Paste with Vinegar
details: Red chili pepper paste mixed with vinegar and sugar to make a more liquid dipping sauce with a sweet and sour taste. This sauce is most commonly served with raw fish dishes.

name: Battered Meat and Vegetable Soup
details: A soup with chicken, beef, shiitake mushrooms, bellflower root (dorajij and minari (Korean parsley) which have been seasoned, dipped in a fleur batter, and cooked in broth.

name: Whole Radish Kimchi
details: A kimchi made of young white radishes used whole with the stems and leaves. The radishes are seasoned with red chili pepper powder, green onions, garlic, ginger and fish sauce, then left to cure. lt literally means bachelor kimchi, because the stems are reminiscent of the long ponytails of unmarried men in traditional times. Also called altari kimchi.

name: Loach Soup
details: A thick, strongly flavored soup made of fresh loach simmered with vegetables, soybean paste (doenjang), and red chili pepper paste.

name: Wild Aster Namul
details: A side dish made with blanched wild aster (a vegetable found in the mountains) that has been seasoned or stir-fried with other ingredients.

name: Ground Beef Jerky with Pine Nuts
details: Dried ground beef jerky garnished with pine nuts.

name: Arrowroot Tea
details: A tea made with the juice pressed from wild arrowroot. Powdered arrowroot can also be used.

name: Home-style Noodle Soup
details: A soup made of wheat flour noodles flattened and cut by hand, served in a hot chicken or beef broth and topped with clams, julienned summer squash, and a seasoning sauce.

name: Simmered Half-dried Pollack
details: Half-dried pollack marinated in a sauce of red chili pepper paste, soy sauce, sugar, green onions, ginger, sesame oil and black pepper, then simmered over low heat.

name: Bean (Soybean)
details: Soybeans are used to make soy sauce, dubu (soybean curd / tofu), and oil.

name: Chilled White Bean Soup
details: A soup made with white soybeans that have been soaked for five to six hours, drained, boiled, and then pureed. The puree is strained to make this creamy, chilled soup.

name: Noodles in Chilled White Bean Soup
details: Chilled white bean soup made of pureed soybeans served with noodles and garnished. with julienned cucumber and watermelon. Sometimes white sesame seeds are added to the puree. This dish is eaten in the hot summer.

name: Soybean Sprout Namul
details: Sprouts about 5-7 centimeters long made from soybeans soaked in water. An inexpensive and popular ingredient for many Korean dishes.

name: Soybean Sprout Soup
details: A clear soup with soybean sprouts.

name: Seasoned Soybean Sprout Namul
details: Blanched bean sprouts seasoned with green onions, garlic, soy sauce and sesame oil. This is one of the most common side dishes served in Korean homes.

name: Rice Cooked with Soybean Sprouts
details: White rice cooked with soybean sprouts.

name: Soybean Sprouts with Vegetable Medley
details: A vegetable medley made of soybean sprout stems, fresh bellflower root, fiddlehead, sliced Korean pear, white radish and carrots tossed with a seasoning of green onions, garlic, vinegar, red chili pepper powder, salt and ground pine nuts. A regional specialty of southwestern Korea.

name: Sweet Rice Cake with Beans
details: Steamed rice cake made with glutinous rice flour and black beans. Sometimes made by adding white rice flour to bean flour and water.

name: Cooked Rice with Beans
details: Rice cooked with various beans, such as black beans, green peas, or kidney beans. Served as an alternative to plain white rice.

name: Soybean Leaf Kimchi
details: A variation of kimchi made of salted soybean leaves mixed with sliced radish and fish sauce and laid between the cabbage leaves.

name: Glazed Black Beans
details: A side dish made of black beans simmered in soy sauce and sugar until glazed.

name: Bean and Rice Porridge
details: A rice porridge made with soybeans that have been soaked in water and pureed.

name: Grilled Beef Kidney
details: Beef kidney seasoned with salt and sesame oil, then grilled.

name: Soup
details: The traditional word referring to soup. Dishes with names that end in ~tang are all soups that have been simmered for a long time over low heat.

name: Mung Bean Jelly Mixed with Vegetables and Beef
details: Slices of mung bean jelly mixed with vegetables, dried laver, and seasoned ground beef. Served cold.

name: Taro Soup
details: Soup of taro (a root vegetable) lightly cooked in water before adding beef and kelp.

name: Braised Taro Stems
details: Dried taro stems that have been soaked in water, dipped in flour batter, and braised with green onions, garlic and other spices.

name: Thick Soybean Paste Soup
details: A thick soup made of one part soybean paste (doenjang) and red chili pepper paste added to five parts water. Vegetables added to this soup vary according to the region and the season.

name: Pickled Freshwater Shrimps
details: A fish sauce made of freshwater shrimps pickled in salt, red chili pepper powder and sometimes green chili peppers, garlic, green onions and sesame seeds.

name: Seasoned Bushy Seaweed
details: A fresh side dish made of a bushy brown seaweed that has been blanched and seasoned.

name: Grilled Whole Chicken
details: Grilled chicken served with either a spicy chili sauce or soy sauce.

name: Whole Chinese Cabbage Kimchi
details: The basic kimchi made in large quantities in early winter. Whole Chinese cabbages are first salted and then a kimchi sauce made of julienned white radish, red chili pepper powder, garlic, green onions, and fish sauce is spread between the layers of cabbage leaves. The seasoned cabbages are put in earthenware jars and left to cure for some time before eating. Also called pogi??kimchi.

name: Deep-fried Seaweed or Vegetables
details: Deep-fried seaweed or the leaves and stems of various vegetables, served as a crispy snack or a side dish. Dried seaweed is the most popular ingredient for this dish.

name: Puffed Rice
details: Crispy rice flakes puffed like popcorn.

name: Green Onion (Spring Onion)
details: Along with garlic, green onions are an integral part of Korean cooking and are chopped and used to flavor most Korean dishes, including meats, fish and vegetables. Green onions are also cooked whole in pajeon (green onion pancake) and pa-kimchi (a variation of kimchi made with green onions instead of cabbage).

name: Meat and Vegetable Bundles Tied with Green Onion
details: Bundles of meat, chili peppers, and julienned egg garnish tied with blanched green onions and topped with pine nuts. Served with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Green Onion Kimchi
details: A kimchi made with lightly salted green onions seasoned with pickled anchovy sauce, garlic and red chili pepper powder.

name: Grassy Seaweed
details: A dark green grass-like seaweed that grows in small bunches. lt is used fresh, seasoned and dried, deep-fried, and put in soups.

name: Seasoned Grassy Seaweed
details: Blanched grassy seaweed seasoned with soy sauce, sugar and black pepper, or a mixture of pickled anchovy sauce, garlic, green onions and red chili pepper powder.

name: Grassy Seaweed Soup with Soybean Paste
details: A soup of grassy seaweed in a broth made of dried anchovies and soybean paste (doenjang). A regional specialty of Jeju-do.

name: Green Onion Pancake
details: Pancakes made of an egg, wheat flour and rice flour batter pan-fried with green onions, chives, beef, clams, mussels and other ingredients.

name: Seasoned Green Onion
details: Finely copped green onions mixed with red chili pepper powder, soy sauce, vinegar, sesame salt and sesame oil. This dish is used to garnish or accompany grilled or pressed meats and is most common in southeastern Korea.

name: Green Onion Soup
details: A soup of beef broth with chopped green onions. A beaten egg is added to the soup just before serving.

name: Red Bean Rice Cake
details: A crumbly rice cake made of layers of rice flour and ground red bean steamed together and cut into squares. This is the most common type of steamed rice cake.

name: Rice with Red Beans
details: Rice cooked with red beans to give it flavor and color. The red beans are steamed in advance then cooked again with the rice.

name: Rice and Red Bean Porridge
details: A rice porridge made with red beans. After boiling the beans, they are strained to produce a liquid which is added to the cooked rice porridge. Sometimes small rice balls are added . This dish is made specially to celebrate the winter solstice.

name: Grilled Scallops
details: Seasoned scallops often grilled with beef and mushrooms.

name: Summer Dumplings
details: Square dumplings filled with seasoned ground beef and vegetables. Served in the summer.

name: Pressed Meat
details: Beef or pork cooked in boiling water and pressed. Served in thin slices with seasoned soy sauce.

name: Ground Beef Jerky
details: Minced beef that is seasoned, formed into flat patties, and dried.

name: Pyeongyang-style Chilled Buckwheat Noodle Soup
details: A soup of buckwheat noodles served in a chilled beef and radish broth and topped with sliced Korean pear, cold meats, white radish kimchi, and a hard??boiled egg. Originates in Pyeongyang, the North Korean capital.

name: Beef or Fish Jerky
details: Dried meat or fish marinated in soy sauce, sugar, and black pepper.

name: Pan-fried Shiitake Mushroom
details: Shiitake mushrooms coated in flour, dipped in an egg batter, and pan-fried. The mushroom is often filled with minced beef and other ingredients.

name: Young Green Chili Peppers
details: Young green chili peppers that are picked before they turn red. Eaten fresh, or chopped and added to stews or stir-fries.

name: Traditional Sweets
details: Many types of traditional Korean sweets and cookies. They vary according to ingredients and preparation method.

name: Korean Table d'Hote
details: A traditional set menu of various dishes served with rice, soup, kimchi and side dishes.

name: Raw Cuttle fish in Water
details: Fresh cuttlefish cleaned, thinly sliced, and served in chilled water.

name: Seasoned Raw Cuttle fish over Rice
details: Thin slices of fresh cuttlefish served over rice with vinegared red chili pepper paste and mixed before eating.

name: Hamheung-style Spicy Chilled Noodles
details: Chewy noodles made from potato starch and served chilled with a spicy chili sauce. The most popular version is topped with raw skate. This style of chilled noodles originates in the Hamheung region of North Korea.

name: Rice Porridge with Clams and Mussels
details: Rice porridge served with shelled clams and mussels and seasoned with garlic juice.

name: Sliced Seafood with Mustard Sauce
details: Julienned jellyfish, squid and cucumber dressed with a mustard sauce.

name: Thick Soybean Paste Stew with Seafood
details: A thick soybean paste (doenjang) stew made with clams, shrimp, crab and other seafood.

name: Pan-fried Seafood
details: Scallops, clams, mussels, shrimp and oysters dipped in a flour and egg batter and pan-fried.

name: Seafood Hot Pot
details: Seafood such as fish, clams, shrimp, and squid cooked in a hot pot with vegetables and beef.

name: Seafood Pancake with Green Onion
details: Pancakes made of a flour and egg batter pan-fried with a layer of green onions and seafood.

name: Sea Cucumber
details: An Asian delicacy, in Korea the sea cucumber is usually served freshly sliced with a dipping sauce of vinegared red chili pepper paste. lt is also dried for preservation, then soaked in water and added to other seafood dishes.

name: Raw Sea Cucumber Slices
details: Fresh sea cucumbers cleaned , sliced and served raw with vinegared soy sauce or a vinegared red chili pepper paste.

name: Sea Cucumber Soup
details: A soup made of dried sea cucumbers soaked in water, seasoned, and cooked with minced beef, onions and cucumbers. Sometimes, the rehydrated sea cucumbers are cooked in a soup seasoned with soy sauce and sesame oil.

name: Hangover Soup
details: A thick soup made from ox bone broth with soybean paste(doenjang), soybean sprouts, white radish, green onions and sometimes ox blood. Also called early morning soup, it is a traditional home-style soup eaten alter a night of heavy drinking.

name: Jellyfish Cold Plate
details: A cold plate of thinly sliced jellyfish, cucumber, Korean pear and cold cuts mixed in a mustard sauce with garlic, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar.

name: Andong-style Bibimbap
details: A variation of bibimbap topped with cooked beef, mackerel, dubu (soybean curd / tofu), egg, white radish, spinach, soybean sprouts and other cooked vegetables and mixed together before eating. Traditionally served at the annual ancestor worship ceremonies in the village of Andong in southeastern Korea.

name: Glazed Walnuts
details: Seasoned beef sauteed on its own then simmered with walnuts until glazed. ln some cases, the beef is left out and the walnuts are glazed on their own.

name: Pumpkin Rice Cake
details: A rice cake made of dried pumpkin mixed with glutinous rice flour, layered with red bean, and steamed. Popular in the southwestern region of Jeolla-do.

name: Pumpkin Kimchi
details: A variation of the basic cabbage kimchi with sliced pumpkin added between the layers of cabbage leaves. This is a specialty of the Hwanghae-do region in North Korea and is popular as a base for kimchi stew.

name: Squash Namul
details: Summer squash julienned and sauteed with green chili peppers, garlic, sesame oil and soy sauce.

name: Pumpkin and Mixed Grain Porridge
details: A thick porridge made of steamed and mashed pumpkin with glutinous rice flour, cooked red beans, and soybeans.

name: Sauteed Squash
details: Squash sliced into half moons and pan-fried with pickled shrimp sauce, wild sesame oil, green onions, and garlic.

name: Stuffed Summer Squash
details: Squash lightly cooked, then slit lengthwise and stuffed with seasoned ground beef, sliced mushrooms, and julienned egg garnish. The stuffed squash is coated in starch, steamed, and served with a mustard sauce.

name: Pumpkin Leaf Wraps
details: Steamed pumpkin leaves used to wrap spoonfuls of rice and other food. Served with a red chili pepper paste sauce.

name: Pan-fried Summer Squash
details: Squash sliced into thin round pieces, coated in flour and egg batter, and pan-fried.

name: Pumpkin Porridge
details: A porridge made of fully ripe pumpkins steamed and mashed, then mixed with wheat flour or glutinous rice flour and simmered until thick. Sweetened with sugar or red beans.

name: Steamed Skate
details: Skate steamed in soy sauce, garlic, red chili threads, green onions, sugar, black pepper and sesame oil. ln Jeolla-do, the skate is usually fermented before cooking. Also called hongeo-eosiuk.

name: Spicy Skate in Vinegar
details: Slices of fresh skate dipped in vinegar, then mixed with red chili pepper powder and other spices. This spicy skate is the main ingredient in Hamheung-style chilled noodles.

name: Seaweed Soup with Mussels
details: A soup made with seaweed and fresh mussels. Dried mussels are used when fresh ones are not available.

name: Rice Porridge with Mussels
details: A rice porridge with mussels and ground beef. A popular dish for the elderly and for babies starting on solid foods. Also called damchaejuk.

name: Braised Mussels
details: Mussels braised in soy sauce, sugar, black pepper and sesame oil until reduced.

name: Beef and Vegetable Brochette (3)
details: Brochettes of beef, bellflower roots (doraji), carrots, shiitake mushrooms, cucumbers and other ingredients cut into strips, sauteed in soy sauce and sesame oil, then put onto skewers and pan-fried.

name: Pan-fried Sweet Rice Cake with Flower Petals
details: Round, fiat rice cakes made of glutinous rice flour, decorated with minced jujubes (Korean dates) or petals of colorful flowers such as azalea, rose, chrysanthemum, and pan-fried. The fried cakes are sprinkled with sugar while still warm.

name: Korean Fruit Punch
details: A sweet drink made of various fruits in omija (fruit of the Chinese magnolia vine) punch sweetened with sugar or honey. Azalea petals are sometimes added for color.

name: Seasoned and Grilled Dried Pollack
details: Freeze-dried pollack grilled with a seasoning of soy sauce, red chili pepper paste, green onions, garlic, sesame oil, sugar and black pepper.

name: Raw Seafood
details: The word raw fish (hoe) usually refers to raw fish dishes similar to Japanese sashimi. However, hoe includes other raw or lightly cooked dishes including other seafoods and meats. Yukhoe refers to a raw beef (see Korean beef steak tartare) and sukhoe are dishes that are only lightly cooked (see parboild squid).

name: Spicy Chilled Noodles with Raw Skate
details: Hamheung-style buckwheat noodles mixed with a spicy sauce and topped with raw or fermented skate. Served cold.

name: Raw Fish and Vegetables over Rice
details: Slices of raw fish and fresh vegetables served in a bowl over rice with vinegared red chili pepper paste. Mixed thoroughly before eating.

name: Black Sesame and Rice Porridge
details: A porridge made of white rice and ground black sesame seeds. Popular as a high energy food.

name: White Rice Cake
details: Rice cake made from white rice flour. The rice cakes are steamed then beaten or kneaded to give them texture. The cakes can be made into cylindrical rice pasta, garaetteok or into square jeolpyeon.

name: Rice Porridge
details: A porridge made of white rice only. The rice is soaked in water, added to plenty of water (about 6-7 times of the amount of rice) then simmered over medium heat until thick.
